reviewText:
Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare is the first CoD to be developed by Sledgehammer Games and the first in a while to innovate in terms of gameplay with abilities like invisibility, jet packs and future weapons.

+Fun campain with great Kevin Spacey performance
+Greater agility changes the flow of multiplayer for the better
+Large graphical upgrade
+Laundry list of video options

-Constrained campaign doesn't let you explore and use the cool toys, limited instead to linear set peices
-Doesn't use Black Ops unlock system, instead requires you to gain an abritrary level to unlcok certain guns and sights  instead of earning credits and allowing the player to choose
-Laser weapon overpowered on PC due to accuracy of mouse control
-Terrible Matchmaking (prestige 0-15 players in one match)
-Bad peer to peer matchmaking instead of dedicated servers
-No server browsers
-No modding
-Low online population in most gametypes
-High ping tolerance
-Too frequent crashes, hangs, connection issues

Go play COD 4 for solid multiplayer and mods. Unfortunately Advanced Warfare is the only CoD of it's type, so either bite the bullet and get it or wait for the sequal and hope it's better.

reviewText:
Dont buy the game just because of the multiplayer (i have 77 hours of multiplayer)

Singleplayer works fine, and the story is ok :)

Multiplayer Review:

What i like about the multiplayer:
The setting, the futuristic stuff, the sci fi stuff, the fast paced gameplay, the movement, the third dimension (maps are big and vertical also)

Problems i had with the game: ( i want to say that my pc is as good as recommended hardware, win10, everything updated, clean pc, dual monitors)

- The game is freezing, like a lot, unplayable, every 10 seconds or so, a half a second freeze. especially the game is freezing when the new map start, its is like insane, you cant even move right.
i thought it was a hardware problem, but it isnt, i have purchased a new gpu, the game works the same, the fix for this is to uninstall the game (remove it completely, verify integrity cache doesnt help) and then redownload all 50GB of the game. (i dont mind the download) but after a few days, the game starts freezing again, which drives you nuts. and if you want, you can repeat the process :D

- The game is crashing, yeah, for a lot, and for a lot of weird reasons.

1. not enough memory crash, i have 12GB of ram, and the game is crashing because i dont have enough memory, even if you have 64GB of RAM it will still crash and give you not enough memory message, Fix is, you need to enable PAGE FILE (i know, doesnt make any sense) set at least 2GB of virtual memory and the game will stop crashing with that error message.
2. the gpu crash, when the game crashes, the screen goes black, and you need to restart your pc, (enabling page file fixes this) i dont understand that one also.
3. the random crash, i have no idea, regular windows error closed this program... they happen from time to time, especially if you chat on steam (using the steam overlay) a lot when you play

- The game is lagging, i mean, when you play a faced paced game like this, everyone needs to have a good connection in order for a game to be ok, but that is not the issue
1. i can understand that after 1 year passes the game loses its players
2. there are no dedicated servers, so most of the time you are connected to some guy (who is the server)
3. half of the players have a bad connection to the server, 2 or 3 bars out of 4 (bars show how good the ping is)
4. most of the time i have 4 bars(max), and other people are like skipping frames, i see him here, then i see him there
5. in a fast paced game like this it is really hard to play like this

- DLC dont work right, i have purchased the extra slots for the armory, and it loaded only after a month (i tried to reinstall the game, switch it on off, restart stuff, it didnt help)


CONCLUSION

dont buy this game just because of the multiplayer

reviewText:
In my honest opinion, this is probably the best CoD in years, probably since MW1 as it was refreshing to play a CoD that tries to be different. There are some interesting weapons, such as EM-1 laser beam cannon that is inspired from Unreal Tournament's Link Gun which is a lot of fun to use while they also introduced double jumps, dodge moves, mid air dodge that does make this CoD a lot faster than its predecessors. The maps are generally well designed with some has gimmicks, like there is a map that is set under the Golden Gate Bridge where there will be a tsunami flooding the map half way which does make the pacing to be a bit different. Also, the maps also offers plenty opportunities to jump and vault around as they do offer more vertical than previous games which is a very welcome change.

However, I still would not recommend this game because of the peer to peer multiplayer systems it uses. The netcode seemed to be poorly implemented with a lot of inconsistency in ping and stability. At this time and age, I do think that games should be shipping with dedicated servers, not laggy inconsistent peer to peer. Due to the poor netcode, most multiplayer matches has been quite a frustrating experience. I could get a smooth game in one match, then, the next match becomes a laggy fest with a lot of minor teleporting and shots that isnt registered by the game.

The campaign is alright, as it is the same run of the mill CoD campaign you expected: Linear, explosive and occasionally surprises you with some smart gadgets. Dont expect much innovations or interesting changes in this one. Kevin Spacey's performance in the game is pretty good though.

At the bottom line, I do not recommend this game. As a game that is predominantly a multiplayer experience, one should not pay a fortune for a laggy and subpar experience.

reviewText:
Just...just don't buy this game.

I went into this purchase feeling optimistic and filled with nostalgia from when I used to play MW2 with all of my high school friends. It reminded me a lot of that - in fact, a little bit too much.

Call of Duty needs to give everyone a little victory. This means that, even if you take the time to become good at the game, you'll only do marginally better than somebody else. The maps are too small to incorporate any real strategy (other than keeping mental notes of spawn points). Anyone running around with a shotgun or an SMG has a good chance of being able to kill you. Because everyone dies so quickly, if an enemy sees your back, you're dead. There's more maneuverability, but it's largely overrated. The maps are slightly more vertical but they still fall victim to CoD map tropes. They all feel like the exact same map, except they differ in how unfun they are. Also, the killstreaks just feel so neutered. They're useless!

Speaking of useless, the devs didn't spend any time balancing weapons. I'll save you time; the strongest gun this time around is the BAL-27. It's an assault rifle, unsurprisingly. If you use anything else, you're automatically at a disadvantage. Although the callsigns encourage you to do novel things, that's the only real reward, and it's usually just arbitrarily done. For instance, there's one callsign for getting 200 kills with primary weapons with 2 attachments, and another callsign for getting 200 kills with secondary weapons with 2 attachments. The first one is monumentally easier, because there's a more varied selection of primary weapons, some of them are really effective, and you generally have a choice of attachments that will satisfy the 2-attachment rule. Secondaries, however...none of the secondaries are good. They deal virtually no damage, have very little range, and are just a pain to use. Moreover, some attachments cancel other ones out. For some reason, you can't use akimbo pistols with laser sights (even though you can do that with primaries). It'd make the most sense, as akimbo is hip-fire only, and laser sights increase hip-fire accuracy. No, instead the only valid two attachment setup is akimbo and silencer. Akimbo ruins your accuracy, and silencer drastically reduces your damage and range. It's literally the worst combo for a weak secondary. Nobody took this into account at any point.

In a nutshell, that's the game's balance. There are plenty more things like that that prove very little testing was done in the three year development cycle that they had.

Oh, and the exosuit - the big claim of this entry? It's OK. It gives you some more options in how you play, and it does as if you have more freedom of movement, but it literally doesn't matter when you gracefully navigate the claustrophobic maps only to die from three BAL shots.

Also, Sledgehammer (that's the dev this time IIRC, they're all the same anyway) doesn't care about improving their netcode. It's terrible. It's not getting any better.

I wish I could get my money back.

I really want to recommend this game and tell you to purchase it.  The storyline isn't amazing but it's better than Ghost by far and it showcases some pretty awesome sci-fi gadgets. The voice acting is top notch. The multiplayer could use some balancing of weapons but there's nothing that a few balance patches couldn't fix...

At the moment, there's a lack of dedicated servers and severe lag/framedrop issues on the PC;  Particularly for AMD users.  This often makes the multiplayer portion of the game almost completely unplayable, especially on certain maps.  Some maps also take an unusual time to load even with RAM/CPU way above the requirements listed.  This includes certain single player maps for the main storyline.

If these issues can be fixed, then I can fully recommend this game and judging from the other reviews, it looks like a lot of people feel the same.

reviewText:
The game brought a new horizon to a half dead series, at first i was worried about the similarity with titanfall, but comes out AW is very unique. With the increased time to kill and exo movement, this could be a great multiplayer game.

But my multiplayer experience is absolutely terrible because of the constant lag spikes and bad optimization for AMD cards, even on my high end pc, i get 25-30 fps on lowest video settings

again they give no F for pc, on discussion board there are no mods or devs to answer questions, nobody knows when will they release a patch

The basics of a MP PC fps game, anti-cheat, dedicated servers, I don't see any so far

If this is on Xbox one, I would probably rate it 8/10, but on a poorly ported PC version, before fix these major issues, I have to thumbs down.

reviewText:
Other then not having the promised dedicated servers its overall a  massive improvement over the previous Cod titles which highly includes Ghost .As a new game to the series it offers a high amount of new experience to players through the great multiplayer gameplay and interesting storyline.
Pros*
- Newly designed maps and new movement system
- Bringing back the FOV option and a huge upgrade on graphic options
- Great leveling up system for weapons + supply drops
- Perfect spawns and balanced weapon damage
- Good PC port for players and offers a new perspective of futuristic warfare
- Brand new Exo system and weapon upgrades
- Theres a lot more ... buy the game and see for yourself
- GHOST NEVER GOT FACEPALMED SO BAD
Cons*
- Lacks Multiplayer weapons ( like even ghost had more weapons )
- Hosted servers and promised dedicated servers ? Like ( shot first die first )
- Double kill tags for attachment unlocks seriously its hard enough to kill one person , and espeically
on open field maps with laggy severs.
- Peer to Peer Connection really ruin the game and created lag issues ( disadvantage
eg ( Spam a whole mag at someone and still not dead)
- Need more multiplayer maps as i feel like im playing the same map over and over
- Are there any more ? Give us our dedicated servers
Well this is recommended to FPS shooters as promised play cod as you never before cause this is true but after when they give us out dedicated servers otherwise newbies to COD will face a disadvantage over veteran players

Overall i give it a 7 / 10 for having the worst multiplayer connection severs until they add in dedicated servers i can truly rate it a 8.5 / 10 .

reviewText:
Summary:  Bland and Predictable.  Way too many Quick Time Events.  Forgettable characters.  Flakey keyboard/mouse controls.

Given what I've encountered playing for 4 hours thus far, if I'd known all this ahead of time I would have given this a pass.  The single-player campaign just doesn't hold water, and reads/plays like a bad B-Movie.  And before anyone asks no - not interested in the Multiplayer at all.  If a game can't stand on it's own in single-player then it's not doing it's job.

The upgrade system feels very much like it's not providing any real benefit. It's more akin to someone feeling like they had to check off a box on the list that says 'RPG elements'.

Without spoilers, the plot is utterly bland and predictable.  The big reveal when it comes about is just so hum-drum that one just wants to get past it.

Combat is a slog-fest.  Typical hide-behind-cover mechanics and ye'olde 'regenerating health' nonsense.

Frankly, if they'd focused less on the vehicle sections... less on the innumerable QuickTime events... and gave the plot something different and interesting, then they might have had something here.  Instead it's just a mess.

Give this game a skip.

Now if you'll pardon me, I'm going to go back to playing some more PayDay 2.

reviewText: I gave the game a bad review out of frustration, but honestly it looks decent when my framerate isnt dying from some particles. It could use some fix releases. My GTX 680 should be able to run this just fine, but I was having horrendous framerate issues in open environments. Hopefully others can avoid this problem.The opening video was a little annoying each time I had to restart after lowering my settings again and again. The gunplay was fine, and the AI wasnt too bad. Anywho, this honestly seems like a fancier cookiecut of previous installments, which is what most of us expect from the franchise. The exosuits seem like a nice touch, for the 10 minutes I was able to run around indoors. As i've said, i'm not into the COD multiplayer, just the SP. Good luck to others who try, though. Not recommended unless you're willing to put time into figuring out why this or that is destroying your frames, if you have the same issues I have.

reviewText:
So, Call of duty 11, Advanced Warfare. He can't be worst than ghost, but actually, he is not a good call of duty on pc.
The connections are awful, the optimization is too. Even with a great pc, you will get menu bugs, stuttering, random crash, this is one of the worst pc version of call of duty. Even with all the demand of the community, they still didn't make a patch for it. I would not recommend you to buy the game.

The singleplay surprisingly run much smoother, and is overall a great experience, I enjoy it, even if it's a bit short (7 hours of playing)
The multiplayer would be a really great experience, if they make patch, for the connection, and for the stuttering and low performances even with great computer (Nvidia gtx970).

If you want an excellent call of duty, which run really smooth and is a lot more enjoyable, buy black ops 2 ! And it has the amazing zombie mode.

reviewText:
This goes for muliplayer:

-Game is poorly optimized, slide show on certain maps
-Inconsitent connectivity, most matches will be plagued with lag and rubberbanding
-Half the equipment is useless in this game
-Terrible spawn system, you can literally spawn in someone's sight
-Most maps are too small for this kind of movement and mobilty, chaos ensures
-Hackers, aimbotters are way too common
-Most game modes (CTF,S&D etc.) have barely any players which leads to extremly long search times
-Random crashes
-Lacky any sense of strategy due to the chaotic nature of the game, you kill a dude and die to the guy who spaned behind you
-No dedicated servers, which leads to no preferences in map choice, which leads to frustrating matches on maps who are terribly designed


I'd say don't get this game if you're only in for the multiplayer aspect of CoD as it feels frustrating and is poorly designed and stuffed with issues. The online community for this game is already dying out on PC, so don't bother.

reviewText:
I want to enjoy this game. I really do want to enjoy this game, but Activision continually Fks the PC community over and over. I'm not buying any DLC for this game, either. Dedicated servers exist, oh yes, but they're still on Black Ops 2 and haven't been moved over to here (which, now that I think about it, is much better considering I play Black Ops 2 much more often.)

Until they get dedicated servers in here, I can't recommend this game to anyone. Also, the player base is extremely small, so good luck finding games.

DO. NOT. BUY. ADVANCED. WARFARE.  Wait until Treyarch's release, and don't pre-order it, either. I love Black Ops 2, but we'll see what Treyarch decides to do. I have very little faith in any new releases of Call of Duty anymore, and I will not be purchasing them until I get a solid couple of hours hands-on with them to see if I like it or not, which I honestly should have been doing in the first place.
Lesson learned.

TL;DR - Lack of dedicated servers ruin the game. Don't buy Advanced Warfare, wait for Treyarch's 2015 CoD, and GET HANDS-ON with the game before you purchase it, otherwise you and I will continue to be fked by Activision.

reviewText:
An unreal tournament rip off.

Was this game rushed? I'd say it most certainly was. There's no dedicated servers, certain graphics settings aren't working as intended, terrible lag/rubber banding, and respawning doesn't make any sense whatsoever. Plus, the maps are ridiculously small to make use of the exo jump abilities - this fault alone makes the multiplayer experience too chaotic to enjoy.

I can't really think of any positives to be honest. The CoD franchise is offically dead for the PC anyway. Don't make the same mistake I did, save your $65. Truthfully, I don't know whether to laugh or cry at the incompetence of the developers.

@AV - Maybe you should spend less money on advertising and create something meaningful.

reviewText: So I just hit Grand Master Prestige and  wanted to give a mid-life game review. I want to state first and foremost I would not recommend this game for the following reasons, almost nothing related to clans work, clan wars hasn't given any rewards for winning, very poor customer support with issues, a ton of issues brought on by patches, very poorly optimized even after they tried tweaking it. reviewText:
This review is writen a bit early but depending on the dev's it's possible that this will be spot on.

+ The game actually looks good and polished even if it's running on the same engine as Ghosts you can tell they cleaned it up alot
+ Single player ok. It's pretty standard as the Single player is on every CoD: it's linear, fast pace, short and vary dramatic. I would say it's slightly better than MW2.
+ Sounds, animations and cinematics are great
+ Gun Firing range is awesome

~ If Ghosts and Black Ops 2 had a baby it would be this game...Unfortunately for it, as far as the pc goes, it took a bit too much from the Ghosts side.

- PC specific issues EVERYWHERE.
- Mouse Accelleration (there's bandaids for this but no fix)
- Random Framerate Drops
- Voice desync (single player)
- Unbalanced Hardcore mode
- Not enough lobbies to play all the modes (mainly classic modes)
- Controls can be frustratingly inaccurate when boosting
- Random Mouse Accelleration specificly after shooting and before/after boosting
- Kill times for both hardcore and normal seem too fast.
- Leveling is too fast
- Kill streaks do not equal the trouble it takes to get them
- Annoying gun mechanics that break running or boosting
- Annoying menus
- Ghosts like maps though they are slightly better
- Unable to see pings and lobbies with laggy people
- No ability to select max ping
- This is an Area Shooter. Strategy rarely comes into play without a direct objective like S&D or Dom
- For as polished as the rest of the game is, it really does feel like PC gamers are getting the shaft in this game
- The coding is in Klingon (no joke).  So instead of polishing the game for pc users they decided to waste their time on other stuff
- Spawns suck almost as bad as Ghosts
- Destiny like dress up system
- Random drops for gear make it so that everyone can look cool, no work required.
- SLI is not supported yet
- Player models are taken too much from ghosts. In my opinion they are way too skinny and awkward looking
- Gun models are too big
- FOV doesn't seem to be the number the setting says it is.
- Black Ops 2 still feels like a superior game although Advanced Warefare does match/exceed it in graphics.

reviewText: I want to love this game.   Cool weapons.   Awesome UT style movment (people say it's like titanfall, which obviously ripped off unreal tournament/epic).  But.. this game is loaded with hackers.  I'm not a noob.  I have 10k hours in FPS, and I can tell when someone is ... either elite or assisted in their aim/prefire/wall.  I cannot believe such a high percentage of my opponents, especially those with <2 years on steam, especially those with <300 hours of FPS gameplay on steam... can be so awesome.  So yeah.. prefire me, out aim me, ignore recoil in killcams, and generally pwn everyone (including me) in game.. I think you're hacking.  I wish it was rare, but it's not.  From what folks tell me, it's like MW2 all over again.  And I've been told that was possibly the most hacked game in the history of FPS.  It sucks not being able to find a game without inhuman aim and prefire.  I may be getting older and drunker.. but this game is amazingly full of BS.   Even people that didn't hack earlier COD (from what I can tell playing with them) are jumping on the 'code solution' in this game.  I really wish I had not bought the 'all DLC included' version of the game and saved myself $40.  I really thought a new developer (ie, sledgehammer games) would be better than Treyarch and their ilk.  Imagine my displeasure at whishing Treyarch had 'done this game'.  Hacking aside, annoyances like no fix for SAC3suppressed sound bug, movement bug when sprinting too often, the ridiculous imbalance among various weapon types, and the constant 'play online.. no service found' type issues .. well, it's sad I paid for this game.  If I had known what I know now, this would not be the game to bring me back to PC after 2 year hiatus.  It would be the game that made me embrace the controller on the xbox360/xboxone.  I wish I had bought this (and other) games on that platform.. which stings being a 10k+ hour veteran of PC FPS gaming.

reviewText: This game can best be described as a pretty cover on a mediocore book. The characters and acting where on point but the story felt rushed and because of that I didnt get pulled into the game the way I had hoped. Control scheme is copy paste from the genre a few interesting aspects involving the 'Elysium' style battle hardware weren't enough to save the absolute lack of immersion. I recall a moments from Battle Field 4, which I haven't played in along time, that put this game to shame.  One big aspect is the lack of environmental influences. I was a soldier and experienced combat first hand....everything around you matters. In COD if I throw a grenade at an enemy behind lets say a vehicle for instance...the vehicle recieves no damage....the windows dont blow out..the tires dont deflate...the thing doesn't even suffer from ballistic shift. This ruined the game for me. Also NPC's dont display true physical atrophy from damage. Its 2014 guys...if I shoot something in the leg I expect it to fall down or hop to cover. If I hit someone point blank with a grenade launcher arms and legs should go flying. This is another example of a AAA hype title and I recommend you stay away from it untill it drops in price. This game is worth a $29 tag so wait till then.

reviewText:
Greetings, I hereby provide the following reasons.

Performance issues:-

Not everyone owns a super computer. I study abroad, my laptop only runs on an 860M. Outdated in today's technological standards. However, capable in performing extra on games such as DAI, Revelations 2, Battlefield 4, Hardline. You'd think that since you're able to play all these graphic intense games, Advanced warfare should probably be a walk in a park. Well, think again. 60 FPS is almost non-exsistent, we're in 2015 for ♥♥♥♥s sake.

Because advanced warfare isn't the most optimised games out there for the PC, running the game for long extensive hours could possibly wear out your hardware at an exponential rate. Updating your drivers could help, but I can hardly call that a fix.

Gaming content:-

The idea of the new supply drop system is by far, the most unique thing about Advanced Warfare. Though some may consider it a just system, i'd like to think otherwise. Most elite weapons that I have used, and by now, I have almost all, have been unbalanced, overpowered, and unfair to the other players who do not own the elite variant. For starters, weapon variants like MOST other games out there should only boost your tactical advantage by a small percentage instead of a huge margin. Players on the battlefield without the elites will feel short and at a total disadvantage during a standard one on one gunfight.

Based on statistics, that a supply drop will only be granted upon first kill/death after every 45 minutes of ingame time. You're looking at a 15% chance on getting an Elite weapon OR cosmetic from each box, let alone random boosters and reinforcements. Because of this, Sledgehammer games have recently pushed out an additional way in obtaining these wonderful Elites from something called the Advanced Supply Drops". Priced at $1.99 (1)

reviewText:
SinglePlayer/Exo Zombies

The first half of the campaign was by far one of the best COD campaigns that have came out, but then it goes to complete crap during the second half. The story itself was acutually good and has pretty good hidden messages regarding the dangers of PMCs and the diplomacy of the U.S, but these are locked away in Intel which 90 percent of players don't get to see. The second half of the campaign was absolute dogshit in terms of the story. It just gets bad real fast. If you gonna get the game just for the campaign, wait until it's under 20 bucks.

EXO Zombies is by far better than Black Ops 2 zombies but it doesn't even come close Black Ops 1 and World at War zombie modes. There has only been one map that has came out so I can't criticize it that much.

Multi-Player- It has a lot of potential on PC but at it's current state, it's not good. This is mainly because this game is dead and has a small playerbase now. Finding matches for other game modes such as Search and Destroy is nearly impossible. PC gets updates weeks later and even then it can take 1 step forward and two steps back. This game is badly ported for multiplayer, there is constant stuttering in some maps and still hasn't been fixed. None of these issues exist in the console versions of the game.

Sadly, like I stated before, this multiplayer has loads of potential on PC, since it feels like a completly different game from the previous titles and even the console versions of this game. This game is extremly fast paced and players with good aim are the ones who dominate. For once, there is a skill gap in a Call of Duty game on PC. The game has lots of customization so it keeps you busy, without it being a complete grind-fest. As well killstreaks aren't that powerful and it requires lots of kills for it to unlock, which I like since the acutual combat remains to be gun to gun.

I'll go for to say that this is the best COD multiplayer since Modern Warfare 2/COD4, but not on PC. If you want to get this game for the multiplayer, get it on consoles. The dead playerbase and the bad port makes the console versions the better option.

I've seen too many cheaters, enemies spawning directly behind me, etc. And all this DLC crap. I believe a game is destined to fail if you charge 60$ for the game then expect us to pay again and again for all these little upgrades. As another review stated it splits the community and in the end (several years from now) IF anyone is playing this game they will be playing the base game and the DLC will fade into exile.

I'll stick with MW2 and 3.

reviewText:
This game is a joke and not even a funny one.

* edit for more info then :

1. The story is a joke you've already been told.
I only expected this game to provide what I experienced with most of CoD games : a decent story packing some spectacular action scenes.
Remember landing in Normandy in CoD 2, planting the Russian flag in World at War or killing civilians in MW2 ? Nothing worth remembering here, everything feels like déjà-vu and in fact everything is déjà-played.

2. The gameplay is a prank
Yeah go ahead jump around with your new equipment... Ooops should have told you that roof was off limits. Did that hurt?"
"Look at all the things you can do... No not now... Nope... Try again later."

"Let's put a QTE here... and here... another one here... and a few there... Oh and make sure they'll have to watch the cutscene... Ok good
date:
now time to pay respects"
I swear I could hear the devs making fun of us.

reviewText:
The pro's:

- It has guns
- It has attachments
- You can have fun with the emblem creator
- The boost mechanic is fun for 5 seconds before it derps.

The con's:

- Same sh*t, different year.  Expect nothing new from this CoD
- Matchmaking seems broken.  I get high ping (one bar, I guess 200+ at least) in every single game.  Much lag and rubberbanding ensues.
- The maps are tiny and filled with camp spots
- The maps have ye ol' invisible walls to stop you from boosting to some places.
- The guns aren't very interesting at all and most of them are either OP or UP. Game needs rebalancing.
- Hit detection has become even worse than it already was.
- 2x headshot needed to kill with sniper? (might be failing hit detection)
- Reskin of previous CoD.
- Often doesn't recognise dodge key combo (doubletap)
- Game is 2 days old and already seen some reports of hackers (Good job on the security)
- The community sucks as much as always, but there's the mute all option to prevent squeely kids.  Which is nice.

On a sidenote:   The single player campaign isn't much to write home about.  Standard 'Murica story is standard.


That is all.  Buy it if you want.  It doesn't seem worth the 60 euro tag.  More like 30.

reviewText:
it's fun enough for a brainless shooter on those days you just want to chill out on, but recently I've seen a pretty big influx of players who are blatently hacking. (snapping to one player, killing them, instantly snapping to another player right behind them.)

though there's always going to be hackers in any game, with the perceived lack of any decent anticheat here, it's going to get you salted right quick. especially when you stop to wonder how many other hackers are going around who aren't trying to be blatent and hide themselves, etc.

the developers are also incredibly console-centric in regards to their updates and don't seem to focus on any data given from PC at all when doing a patch for it, which is incredibly noticable with it comes to balance issues. advanced warfare also shipped out in a terrible state of optisimation that leaves more then a few maps unaccessible due to lag. however, playing mosh pit dosen't put you in these maps thankfully.

if you're looking to get this game, save yourself a lot of trouble and just get it on console.

reviewText:
I have almost 600 hours of Multi player gameplay, the game itself is great fun. However, the porting of this game feels like it was done by some teenager, every update doesn't fix the main issues and tends to break something else. This could have been a great game for all gaming communities, but sadly COD just doesn't seem to care anymore.

Still on an old dying engine, old ghost coding being used, people with top of the line computers having graphical issues. Lag compensation is ridiculous. Set latency at 800, who the heck can play above 200?

This game could have been as popular as CS:GO for the PC community, but they just had to be greedy. We still have not seen dedicated matchmaking servers, their promise of it being a mixture of the two is an out right lie.

The fact that they even bother making it for PC is beyond me, they obviously don't care nor do they do proper testing of their game. They continue the catering to Xbox users, which is still beyond me, when we all pay the same if not more as xbox users.

Until they give us rentable servers my advice is don't buy this game or any other COD title, unless you have a an Xbox.

reviewText:

An overall let down.

reviewText:
Call of Duty Advanced Warfare is a step in the right direction. It does somethings very well, they added game mechanics bring some new life to an otherwise stagnate franchise. Though everything that they added into the game also breaks the game. The new exo-suit works great to add more mobility to the game. This also causes the Call of Duty 3 lane map system to go out the door. You can reach any part of the map with ease now. You will constantly find yourself being shot from behind and unknown places. I almost feel as if its added to much mobility. To the point where the game feels rushed to to fast paced for my taste. You need to have 360 degree awareness at all time of you will be killed from behind every time.  Also the killstreaks for once seem under-powered and take more work to earn them. So when you kill 7 people for a UAV it doesn't seem very useful.

Now I'm not saying this a bad game by any means, because its not. I see CoD AW as a better game then the last few  in the Call of Duty series.  Its diffrent and thats what makes it better, but the improvement just isnt enough. It seems like the new stuff AW added just seems sloppy and there are other games that do it better.

Pros:
New Content
New Game Mechanics
Fast Pace

Cons:
No dedicated servers
Bad Netcode
Poor optimization
Unbalanced Guns
Weak Scorestreaks
Fast Pace
Same copy and paste storyline
voteText: 15 of 21 people (71%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Pros: better graphics, double jump similar to The Unreal engine, many game modes that include also s&d, domination..etc from the earlier versions of cod, smooth moving even while double jumping obstacles.

Cons: Constant crashes without crash reports or anything. Not unlike any cod or other games this is seriously definitely the most crashing game that I ever owned. Crashes happen randomly while ingame: after a few seconds, minutes or hours. Secondly: most of the times you wont find a match in multiplayer lobby. You will lose 1h of your life staring at unmatched lobbies and the game will never start. And finally if you find a match you are going to play, it's going to be with unplayable ping, rendering the game mostly ridiculous. Said this it surely blackens the name of all the other call of duty titles.
My conf: i7 4820k, ddr3 32gb, asus geforce gtx 770.
What i tried: everything. Nvidia experience default settings, and after that all possible graphics settings, reinstalling the game from 2 ssd in raid on a sata drive, checking the windows event viewer, searching the forums.

Summary: unfortunately this game is unplayable, and in my opinion it shouldnt even be released in europe due to its malfunctioning. I strongly unrecommend this game to everybody.

reviewText:
Ok where do i start?
My cousin bought me this game (and himself double burnt)
I really wanted to like this game I watched videos and thought about it for a few weeks and then just fell into the hype. I swore last year that after ghosts It was going to be my last call of duty.
But with it being a 3 year development surely it must be good? Well yes and no.
The ideas seems very fun, even though i prefer titanfalls controls speed/jumping compared to AW. I like the perks and even the level designs.
I like pretty much everything about the design.
Single player is stunning and I couldn't argue that its one of the nicest looking games on PC.

So here lies the problem, which has been the major problem with cod for a few years now!
Is there a perk for bendy bullets/see you coming before I did/drop in one shot yet takes 5 to kill them? NO!
Or I haven't found it yet.
Yes its lag, Its P2P and its bad, like really really bad.
My ping bar (as they don't seem to show proper ping rates) is erratic, like all over the place, the full lobby is also. 1-4 all over the place. I'd say like a roller coaster whilst listening to venga boys up & down".

date: it takes 5 bullets to drop them and seems to be one shot to get yourself killed. Replays show something different.\nIts like people have a massive advantages and that they are well ahead on time than me

reviewText:
After playing a few days, I decided to give this a review. (I have 64 hours in multiplayer)

The new movement system is awesome, it is similar to unreal tournament (gameplay is far from it obv, but you know what I mean). The whole idea is great, but the execution sucks once again. No dedicated servers, and I am not able to join many games since my NAT type is closed (my ISP locked my router and will not change it), I am left barely finding any lobbies and cant even play with my friends.

Also, cheaters. I have rarely ran into any hackers in the past few CODs, but this one is different. I run into a cheater about every 3-4 games.

A few good things is that there are no claymores in this series (THANK YOU).

There are lots of bugs in multiplayer and (EDIT) after 2 months are STILL not fixed. Such as everyone on the map hearing the silenced vector shots as if they were shooting it. Also the movement has a great idea but its clunky, its hard to explain it but when you tap opposite directions, you shouldnt accidently" dodge in one. Also the akimbo vectors take literally no skill
date: pretty much like akimbo FMGs in MW3 or G18s in MW2 equivalent.\n\nThe singleplayer was pretty good
hoursPlayed: but pretty good. It is better than ghosts (well anything is)
voteText: but my fav single player moments are still in CoD4 and MW2. Spoilers aside

reviewText:
what can I say.
New year, new CoD.
It is new.
It is not Ghosts (looks like Ghosts).
The graphic engine seems unoptimized.
The weapons are the weakest in the series. If in MW2 or any other CoD game you needed one burst hit of 3 burst weapon, in AW you need 3x3 or 3x4 hits so that the enemy would die.
The sniper is same as Ghosts, except that the last sniper ca't be noscoped with. LOL how woudl a gun know if I am looking through the zoom or not.
The Tsunami wave is ridiculously unreal, I personally have minor lagspikes on the map and some peopel have complained that it crashes in loading screen.
The jumping is ridiculous, close fight becomes impossible to hit each other mid air and adding the lowerpowered weapons you spend 3 entire magazines to kill one enemy.
The maps in general are not epic.
All in all, don't waste your money, but if you like CoD series or if you are 13, you will enjoy the game (parents, don't buy +18 games for kids, we got enough ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ not playing objective, camping in the corner and shouting in squeeky voice).

reviewText: Once again what could have been a great game on PC has been let down by lack of PC support on Activision's part. Once again they lied to their customer base promising dedicated servers pre launch (there are various sources in which the developer promised we would get dedis this time). Once again we get stiffed with console style P2P hosting, because the devs / publisher are unwilling to properly support the PC community's needs, regardless of statements made prior to launch. This game could be the best COD in some time, but laggy lobbies due to lack of dedicated servers, cheats & hacks remaining unchecked & various other connectivity / crashing issues + the ridiculous map load times leading to connection timeouts make this purchase more frustrating than fun. this will be my final COD purchase ever if they do not give us dedicated servers, as promised. Basically it's Ghosts all over again. Same getting bent over by Activision as last year... only this time there's a little lube

reviewText:
1. This game runs poorly on any computer with less power than the starship enterprise... it actually reduced my slightly old gaming pc to a pile of hot slag.
2. The lobbies are DEAD AS HELL! Probably because of half-♥♥♥♥♥ support and god-awful community management by SHG.
3. Weapon balance is terrible. SHG took way too long to sort out the high-framerate EM1 fiasco, the overall selection is basically a bunch peashooters, with the exception of like one weapon per category. Special mention goes to the Asm1, which is a direct port of the most OP smg from BLOPS 2, except now instead of being only a minor performance outlier, it's now in among a selection full of really bad weapons, so a slightly OP weapon from a past game becomes so absurdly powerful in this one that it's the only thing most people use. (aside from aimbotters and 120 fps supercomputer types, they use the EM1)
4. The exo suits started as an interesting gimmick, but really they just turned the game into a hybrid aimbot heaven/60$ advertisement for adderall where everyone just rocket-farts around while spamming high rpm weapons.
5. The maps (especially Defender) are about as lag free as operating the mars rover with a 1 kbps connection.
6. Treyarch's CoD games are vastly better and a new one is releasing soon :-)

reviewText:
I will review all 3 aspects of the game in 1 review, the TL;DR version is simple... Worst COD I've ever played.

Campaign (4/10, interesting storyline, everything else poor)
The first 5 missions featured nothing massively interesting or unique, it was relatively boring and didn't make a good first impression. Thankfully it sped up and more unique and engaging missions were available but still, not on the same level as previous COD's. I found the storyline to be above average, the concept of biological weapons and a central power house is a lot closer to reality than people believe... Sledgehammer's take on this was nice to see. UNFORTUNATELY, the characters audio and lips were so out of sync and on my second play through the audio had vanished completely (many people have experienced this). Beyond this the way cut scenes worked was nothing short of a joke, they were long and you had no way of skipping them (even if you had already seen them previously). Finally, a problem with every recent COD, it was FAR too easy... I played through on Veteran and died 3-4 times.

Exo-survival (3/10, easy and excruciatingly long)
I disliked everything from the aesthetics, to the functionality and length. Why does it do round count in X^2? O.o Anyways, aesthetics are a minor flaw, the real problem is how painfully easy it is. On my first map, bio-lab, I reached round 144 (where my friend had to leave) and I thought we were great... I quickly realised we're not and the reason we reached that round number was because it is insanely easy. There are 12-15 maps to complete and you have to clear a certain amount of waves per map to unlock the following maps (around 25). It claims that each set of maps become more difficult but this is a clear lie, the only thing that was more difficult about them was maintaining concentration after the hours of boredom. The last wave had zombies and a cute twist but it's not worth all the time spent, it was used soley to boost DLC purchases... disgusting.

Multiplayer (2/10, worst gaming experience ever)

I don't know where to start so I've broken it down into what my main issues are with this game:
- General issues
- Movement > Accuracy
- Classes
- Ranked play
- Developer support, you buffed the laser?

My general issues are somewhat trivial and personal, but here they are. There's no public combat record, the combat record to me was a mark of who you were as a player and how good you were. In previous COD's you could see someone's stats in the pre-game lobby and if he had 100+ nuclears with 400 unstoppables and a 2KD you'd recognise that he is good... you also knew if his Win/loss ratio was only 0.5 that he was a camper. This is absent in AW and for no good reason, there is a private combat record so why hide it? And why hide the number of players ingame? With a lack of players on PC it's imperative for me to know how many people are in each playlist so that I know I'm not wasting my time searching for a SND game at 1am. I also believe this feature, or lack thereof, has resulted in less people playing gametypes that are not called TDM or Domination. Thankfully, FOV slider was implemented from day 1 :D but it resets every time you go into 3rd person... which SND forces -.-

Movement in this game sounded like a great idea but it has been pushed too far; you can jump too high and boost-dash too fast. It has increased the pace of an already fast FPS to a disgusting speed where no control can be maintained playing solo, any player can be anywhere on the map at any given time and you have no way to stop them... map control is now a myth. When a player dashes they move too quickly to be tracked, you have to alter your thought process to shoot at the area their dash will finish (unless you have a controller, controller players are a joke on AW). Due to this fundamental change the game is no longer about who can aim more, it is about who can button bash the most... we might as well rename it to Tekken warfare. In SND you will most likely enoucnter an enemy within the first 4-5 seconds, in the following 4-5 seconds it is entirely possible that the other team is already in your full flank. In CTF / Uplink you can run the ball / flag across map in little over 5 seconds... yet the respawn delay is set to 5 seconds? This would be fine if it was balanced, but it isn't... there is no negative aspect to the speed (except appearing on the mini-map, which can be easily countered and is not an issue in respawn gametypes due to the speed). In previous COD titles in order to be on the 3rd story of a building you had to sacrafice time and positioning for it, you could see limited areas of the map and in order to get down you had to fall or use a ladder / stairs which all come with disadvantages. In AW you can free flow between ground / 2nd / 3rd floors in seconds without any consequence.

Perks / equipment and streaks are perhaps the area they destroyed the most, since we already had a system that worked just fine. For someone who enjoys streaking, the perks are a mess, 4 of the neccessary streaking perks are in the 3rd slot with almost nothing useful in the 1st and 2nd slot. They've also removed deadsilence which means in SND the soundwhoring is a joke, it's not a big deal in respawn however. My primary problem with this is they removed it on the basis that they don't want perks that are 'essential'... YET THEY KEPT IN TOUGHNESS!?!?! I remember painkiller being annoying, it was disgusting, then we moved on and I was happy to leave deathstreaks in the past :) But AW went 'maybe we should bring back painkiller?, yeah maybe we should bring it back and make it readily available whenever you want with no sacrafice required'. Exo-Stim is a joke... INVISIBILITY is a joke. Yes if they're moving it's easy to see them but if they corner camp inside hills where nades and players are flying everywhere it's impossible to find them. The exo-abilities are reason enough to rage, nevermind anything else... but there's much more. Due to double jumping all forms of explosives are now completely overpowered, you can double jump and fire down a rocket launcher destroying everything (flak jacket doesn't save you), previously campers had to go to standard elevated camp spots to fire their noob toobs, now they have free reign to do whatever the ♥♥♥♥ they want and it's simply out of control. Stun grenades... stun grenades... please give me strength. Stun grenades are EBOLA. They stun you (this is fine), FLASH YOU, AND BUST YOUR AIM. They have 3 effects which no 1 perk can counter, meaning if you want to truly counter them you are forced to run 2 perks (which means sacraficing blast surpressor because toughness is essential) - this has hindered competitive drastically in my opinion. Finally, the streaks are completely useless unless they have 3 modifications which makes them slightly better, a fully upgraded Paladin requires 1800 score approximately and will get you 5ish kills... useless.

Ranked play is what I expected to be the only saving grace, however pre-patch it included momentum, non-competitive maps, 0 restrictions on class set ups and the availablity of on-going sessions to searching players. The amount of times I joined games into a losing situation because previously people had rage quitted... AND LOST POINTS because of it. I will not get into too much detail because they patched it and fixed many things, LASER STILL ISN'T BANNED THOUGH IS IT.

I am next to the character count so I have to be quick, THE DEVELOPERS ARE ♥♥♥♥♥. No dedicated servers, patch release took over 1 month, no anti-cheat... waste of time and money. On console (due to no aim assist when hipfiring) the laser was not OP so they buffed it, however PC aim is the same ADS or not, this shows how little COD developers care about PC players.

I hate this game.

reviewText:
Call of Duty has become sort of a joke in the gaming community. Its linearity and oh-so-serious stories have faltered since the first Modern Warfare, its multiplayer devolved into a world where everyone has apparently gone all the way with your mother at only age ten. While many criticisms about Call of Duty still apply, Advanced Warfare somehow has recaptured my interest in the franchise; but it's not without many flaws.

Campaign- 7/10

(Contains minor spoilers)

Before I get too deep into this, Call of Duty's formula for campaigns is well known. If you don't enjoy action movie plots and scripted action sequences, look elsewhere. For those who are familiar or not bothered by this fact, here is what I thought of the campaign.

Advanced Warfare starts out strong, with a gorgeous opening cutscene and a fun first level; sadly, this quality doesn't continue through the rest of it, save for the cinematics. Kevin Spacey does an excellent job as Jonathon Irons, the leader of ATLAS, a private military corporation quickly gaining fame and respect. However, his character is limited and there's not too much to say about Irons. He's a man with strong ideals, but these ideals don't amount to much when his entire character arc becomes a very dull experience to watch. Irons could be an interesting character, but (trying not to spoil anything), his story could definitely have been more fleshed out. Instead, you get a direct and forgettable character saved by an extremely good performance. The thing that hurts about Irons is that he could've been so much more.

Outside of that, the Call of Duty campaign rules remain in place; for the most part. Minor upgrades to your exo suit replace Black Ops 2's loadout system before each mission, and first person cutscenes are gone. These are replaced with extremely gorgeous cinematics played during the loading screens; I greaty enjoyed those, but if you're looking for that final knife throw... it's gone.

The linearity of the campaign is questionable. If you like exciting, scripted action sequences then this will be a joyride for you. Enemies pop out of cover, you shoot them, and then something blows up and it's apparently important. Car chases that have you hopping from one car to another kept me at the edge of my seat, and beautiful areas kept it feeling fresh. However, a common theme in Advanced Warfare's campaign once again arises; it could've been so much more. There's a mission where you can freely grapple onto enemy helicopters, bridges, and the likes. That was ridiculous fun, and it actually would improve the rest of the game if it imitated that admittedly sparing freedom.

Advanced Warfare does a good job of creating yet another Call of Duty campaign, but it only shows fleeting signs of true greatness through out. One can only hope that the next game can embrace the idea of player freedom, with less linearity. A solid start to what will inevitably be a sub-franchise.


Multiplayer-

7.5/10

Once again, I must start this section of the review with a disclaimer. Almost all of the common complaints towards Call of Duty's multiplayer remain unchanged. If you did not like the past multiplayer, chances are you won't like this either. Regardless, this is an extremely fun and addicting experience that just can't be for everyone.

Every FPS seems to have a niche to fill. Big open battles? Go play some Battlefield 4, or even hit up Planetside 2 if you want truly massive ones. Want a great story and fast paced multiplayer with team coordination? Halo's your game. Want cooperative fun? Borderlands is there for that. (I may be ridiculously biased towards that one though.) Call of Duty fills the adrenaline-pumping niche. Nothing gets me more excited in a game than running around with a KF5, blasting away at enemies and rabbit punching them sky high. The thing is, I don't really have any stories from the multiplayer. In Battlefield 4, I can tell about when a buddy and I hid out in a crumbling building as tanks roared outside, directly into my C4 trap. In Far Cry 4, I can blabber on about the time my friend and I got attacked by honey badgers and I got my elephant killed doing so. In Call of Duty, all my stories are the same; I punched some guy and then I killed another enemy. Lots of badges popped up, and that's when I realize there's nothing else to it.

A good change to the multiplayer is obviously the exo suits. Sliding, boosting, and punching my way through multiplayer matches was fast and glorious. You also kill and die a little bit slower, allowing for much longer firefights. This opens up the matches, and makes them far more fun.

However, getting into a good match is rare. Without a server browser/dedicated servers, you can generally only find games of Mosh Pit or Team Deathmach. This is a huge problem with the multiplayer, and needs to be fixed as soon as possible. Otherwise, I'm not sure how long it will hold up.

Final Verdict-

All in all, Call of Duty remains Call of Duty. It's fast, it's fun, and it's fleeting. Its characters are shallow and the campaigns explosive. Its multiplayer is ridiculous fun and intense. It's still Call of Duty, but there's something to be said about this year's entry; it's different. The exo suits are a great addition, and a great way to improve gameplay. It may be more of the same, but when the same is so good and happens to be some of the best in a long while... is that so bad?

My final verdict for Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare is a solid 8/10.

EVERYTHING!

reviewText: I have never purchased a COD game for the campaign.  I don't hink I have ever even played more thna 5 minutes of any of them, I am 100% multi-player.  This a COMPLETE waste of money.  Do not be fooled by the hype like I was.  This is my message to all fellow Steamers, DO NOT BUY THIS!  It's a dumbed down console game with P2P servers only.  The person with the WORST connect, HOSTS the game.  Shooting someone first, means nothing, hitting someone 10 times n your screen means nothing.  The killcam will show you missing with most of your shots.  Maps are small and with jumping, it's just a mass of hopping and spraying.  I am partially to blame for this POS's existence, I paid for it with hard earned $60 and will never buy another COD again.  Activision 1, Sledgehammer 1, PC gamers 0

reviewText:
Pros:
- Graphics
- Exo suit changes gameplay

Cons:
- Very linear and narrow single player missions, killing replayability
- Sound effects are incredibly poor, guns don't sound like guns at all
- Multiplayer uses P2P networking which means horrible lag fest


Single player is okish, the Exo suit brings some nice changes to the gameplay, but the story is still over the top and quite silly, and the missions are very, very linear and narrow, with hand-holding all the way, killing the replayability the Exo suit could have provided.

The visuals are very nice, but I'm not sure they could have spent less effort on the sound effects if they tried. The guns don't sound anything gun-like, with very little (if any) environmental effects like reverberation and so on.

The multiplayer is using P2P networking which is horrible, with excessive lag compensation. Of course there's lobbies too which means lots of waiting to get into a game. Yet, even with it's lobbies, the multiplayer in Black Ops 2 is vastly better than in AW.

With only SP being worth playing, and SP having poor replayability, it's not really worth the full price tag, better wait for a 75% sale.

Latest Call of Duty game i really liked was Black ops 1, after Black ops 1, they had some minor chances.
Now that we came to the newest Call of Duty games. Its been more about the future.
I think this was a really bad move for Call of Duty, i loved the old school play.
I was also using sniper the most of the time, but in CoD:Ghost and AW sniper is just ruined.
Now you have guns, that almost no recoil has. I really think CoD has reached the end.
So if you are an old cod player, and thought about buying this, wait till its on sale for maybe 10 euro. (Yes its not worth more) Why? Well the guns are unbalanced, and the worst thing of this game... Its the jetpack jump or whatever it is, you can now double jump to activate a jetpack. In my opinion its just so ridiculous.
2/5

reviewText:
so here is an honest review, no bs, just the truth about this game
i really wanted this game to be awesome and it has its moments, the campaign is fun to play and the graphics are great the only thing not so great is how predictable the story is, like really its story is just your average run of the mill action story line starting  with the very cliche battle scene where your friend dies and after that it takes another very cliche turn where the man you are working for turns out to be evil so you and your band of misfits feel the need to go and stop him and of corse you suceed  with a typical no strategy guns blazing tactic....really sad on how easy i was able to guess what was going to happen next and get it right

as for the multiplayer....oh the multiplayer.... well for starters weapons do not do enough damage, most assault rifles feel like long range SMGs and some guns shouldnt even be in the game because you wont even be able to get enough kills to get a UAV, the spawn system is also a huge problem, not like other call of dutys where as you have the occasional person spawn behind you, literally just as you shoot someone infrount of you some comes up from behind and wastes you and that right there will be 90% of your deaths, there is also not much variation between the guns players use because only a handfull of guns are good and actually worth putting time into.

As for the exo suit its cool but really the only thing it gives you the ability to do is boost jump, which should not be in multiplayer.....the maps are designed for the exo suits so that you can jump up to new floors and rooftops, which means  it allows people to move across the map to quickly which in return cause more people to spawn behind you and kill you

this next rant is more of a personal preference, the guns. Almost all weapons in this game do low damage with a high rate of fire.....they all feel like SMGs and a big thing for me is the sound, they dont sound threatening or have any beef to them, ive bought toy guns for my little cousins that sound more bad @$$, the machine guns also all sound the same or atleast close enough as to where you cant tell them apart...if you want to know what they sound like just put your lips together and blow out air, kind of like a machine gun sound you would make as a kid....thats what they sound like

now i could go on but im going to cut it off here, it feels like any of the last call of dutys and starts out making you feel the same to, you will enjoy it at the start and think that all the bad reviews are wrong but id say around level 30 you will become bored of it and wish you hadnt dropped the money on it like i have, they really need to put some time into their next game, which we know they wont, they probably already have a new game in the making that is the same as the rest, which is sad because there hasnt been a great call of duty in a long time
and well....thats the review

reviewText: Overall, I do like this game for the improved gameplay mechanics and SinglePlayer campaign although being lackluster in a sense that you can predict key plot points quite easily in the first hour or so into the campaign. reviewText:
Single player is as usual an enjoyable campaign, tons of action, great story and great protagonists. Overall performence of Single player is excellent and smooth gameplay.

Mutliplayer on the other hand, not so much. The exo-suits are great at first, they become fun and make the game faster paced, but they quickly get annoying and boring.

Performence is somewhat ok, occasional stuttering and frame drops (even on my SLI build).

Now for the bad parts; the servers are shocking, promised dedicated servers but in fact uses P2P. Matchmaking is shockingly bad putting low levels in with multiple prestige players. There's tons of 5+ prestige players already thanks to one over-powered, and over-used gun...the BAL-27.

Multiplayer is ridden with high prestige players, all using the BAL-27 and drop-shotting, only positive to take from mltiplayer is snipers aren't so popular anymore.

I'd only recommend this game if you enjoy getting angry.

reviewText:
Game is probably enjoyable, but when I pay to play on someone else's ♥♥♥♥ internet, it isn't that fun. Furthermore, PC has 0 support for groups/partys when it comes to matchmaking. The vast majority of time, half of your group won't be able to connect to you. This creates an interesting musical chairs act of seeing who's party we can join. No party chat, terrible UI that seems as if it's design is solely for console.

No accurate leaderboards (the majority have updated once total), awful hit reg (client side hit marker fireworks show with none actually hitting), customization that was so shoddily implemented it would've been better off scrapped.

The single player and multiplayer are delivered as two seperate 45gb downloads, which fills my brain with all sorts of ♥♥♥♥. Want to quit after getting cross map meleed? Hit escape and instantly start loading the singleplayer game. This and the afterthough of groups in multiplayerSCREAMS untouched console version imported to PC. Another ♥♥♥♥ PC release from a triple A company. Be prepared for all the updates /dlc a year down the road (only for premium subscribers), and you got yourself a game that repeatedly beats you like an abusive spouse who then demands more money.

ca$hcow/10
domestic violence/9

reviewText: I've never been one of those who has to buy the latest COD or Battlefield game upon launch. In fact, I never buy them. However this time I splurged and decided to pick up CODAW to pass the time until Fary Cry 4 drops or I get my throttle and download Elite Dangerous. Because I haven't played 15 other versions of this, I have to say I enjoyed it. Sure, there isn't much that we haven't already seen in either film, TV or other games, but the gun play is fun, some of the exo abilities are cool, most of the areas are visually strong, the sound design is really sharp and, well, Kevin Spacey...pretty cool. Keyser Soze, lol. It annoyed me that the game decided which exo abilities you were armed with each time out because I would have picked my go-to setup and stayed with it. Minor issue. However, what isn't a minor issue is the fact that a company would charge me $60 for the privelege of stuffing my computer with an absolutly massive download file, and then, when I fire the game up (to run on a four-month old GTX 780ti) the first half of all the cinematics jerk and stutter so bad that they're impossible to watch. Jump into some multiplayer, you say. Ok, I'm actually typing this review while my character is lagged out humping a wall. I kid, but you get the point. Why in the world has it become the standard in the gaming industry to give the consumer a shoddy, incomplete experience with a premium price tag. I liked a lot of the game, but if you were asking me if you should buy it today, the answer is no. Maybe later.

reviewText:
Summary: New features not presented in any COD before. But definitely missing key aspects of earlier COD, such as balance, survivability, slaying, and functional scorestreaks. That aside, there are many bugs for PC users, and noticable lag in kill cams.

In my opinion, this is the worst COD I have played, and I have played all since COD4.

That being said. This game's main feature is exo movements, but it is argueable whether or not the movements contribute to fun gameplay. The increased mobility adds a new element and quicker game pace, but I often find there is seldom tactical use of dashing and much more dash and jump spamming. Even if you do use the dash as a way to dodge bullets, it is rare that it will work due to the heavy amount of lag comp in the game. Dashing quickly behind a corner as you are being shot it will often result in you dying anyway. Then as you watch the kill cam, everything will be a second behind what you saw on your screen. This is a major problem in this game and often ruins any fun I am having.

Guns and perks have little balance, and this COD has less balance than any other COD I have played. Even earlier games with stopping power had worse balance than this COD. Blast suppressor removes the exo movement ping on the mini map, This makes Blast suppressor necessary, which essentially removes any stretegic gameplay aspect. You will die from behind countless times wondering how the enemy even flanked you without any warning. On top of this, footsteps are nearly silent. Enemy callouts were supposed to make up for this but they do little. On top of this they made it so you can have a stealth perk in every tier. Low profile is overused making UAV essentially worthless.

All of these things combined with map design make choke points non existent. One of the major advertising points for AW was that they had 3 lane maps, but with the exo movements, terrible spawns, and abundance of stealth perks, the choke points have been almost eliminated. Spawn trapping has been almost removed from the game, except in a few levels where you can basically kill them as soon as they spawn. Spawn trapping has been a viable and effective method in many CODs and always added a way to control their spawn point and yours meaning you would not have enemies sneaking up behind you ruining your streak. Without that in this game, getting streaks is very difficult.

Speaking of streaks, they essentially nerfed streaks hard. They decreased how easy it is to gain streaks, and decreased how effective streaks are. In domination (known for having sturdy spawn points in previous cods), you only get 50 points towards a streak per kill, 150 per point capture, and 125 for each defense kill (kill enemy capturing point) and attack kill (kill while you capture point). This means playing the slayer role is worthless.

Don't believe the hype in this game. I think it is even worse than ghosts was aside from increased mobility. The time to kill is brutal and feels horrible when you add the lag comp. I see this game as being a favorite of kids, but if you like any amount of stretegic, planed game play, then don't play this. It is at best a mosh pit of chaos with little order.

reviewText:
It has everything it needs to be a decent shooter. New game mechanics, new weapons types, interesting level design, You can change FOV, it has dozens of graphical options to tweak to get the best mix of performance and looks you want, and a campaign which has some novel new concepts (Sonic bombs to dampen all of the sound around you).

Unfortunately though the developers don't seem to truly get the PC market. P2P connections for multiplayer is not acceptable. It works for 1v1 games like Starcraft 2, but not for twitch based shooter games. For one player (The host) he has up to a second advantage on all of his oppontents. For other players we are instead treated to a slide show of characters popping around the screen, bullets coming out of thin air before a model appears in its place seconds later. You'll be jumping over a building only to suddenly be standing where you had jumped from. Clear a deadly gap and move forward, only to be suddenly falling to your death as you now didn't make the jump.

I played this game with a group. 4 On the east coast US, and one of us in England. You get one guess who the host was chosen to be. There is no separation of players what so ever. Players in California will be pitted against those in Russia. Pings are listed in bars like we were still in console. 5 bars (Full strong connection) Is equivalent to a 140 ping or less. That's right. 10 ping or 140 are both Strong connections" according to Treyarch. Though you will rarely get a game full of 5 bars
date: generally one or two 5s and the rest 1 or 2 bars as it connects you to a game in Austrailia.\n\nThis could be a good game with dedicated servers and a server browser
recommended: but instead the COD series continues its downward spirals with nonsensicle completely unthought through bad decisions and ♥♥♥♥♥♥ porting choices. Why go to such great lengths to give us graphical controls and not dedicated servers? Figure that out and you'll discover why Call of Duty continues to sink lower into the abyss of mediocre gaming."

reviewText:
Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare Multiplayer Review
Improved Ghosts but still lacks behind Black Ops 2"


New Quick movement/gameplay is good to get to the places but annoying when people are just jumping over your head and under you without any planning or thoughts
date:
hoping to get a kill. It can get really chaotic at times when you are trying to get a kill and what enemies are doing is just boots jumping in every direction even tho they end up flat on the wall and there is nowhere to run. CHAOS!

Character models are tiny. Easily mistaken by objects if someone decides to camp or headglitch (just like in Ghosts)

Spawining is a problem but it cant be help when gameplay is so quick in many occasions you will end up runing into people who just spawned behind your back.

UAV and Scorestreaks are almost pointless
recommended:
its almost impossible to achive last "KS's" without a party who camps (plays defensivly)

If you ever meet party of people who hold one side of the map. Game is basicly over. There are still places you can camp in if you know your teammates are behind you and you wont get flanked.

Lucky my copy for free and I didn't have to pay for it. If you have any brain on the head and consider what's good for you. Try something else. Perhaps Battlefield or any previous COD games except Ghosts.

You want to live longer happier life? Don't buy this game.

reviewText:
People demanded change, it happened.And they still complain and cry over dumb things.

Anyway, this is a brief review of Multiplayer part.My Singleplayer campaign score is 9/10,I don't know what you expect but this has a great campaign for a FPS game.


PROS
------
+Drop system
+Clans are really nice
+Emblems/customization overall is great
+Graphics are pretty damn good (which I don't give a damn but some do )
+Gameplay is dynamic,fast and easy to learn.

CONS
------
-Weapon balance is terrible.Assault Rifles are overpowered, Submachine guns are terrible.
-There is a Laser Rifle called EM1, OP and ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥.Please don't make ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ weapons just to make game look like more futuristic.
-Hacks.Lots of, lots of hacks.Game was perfect in first week, when no hacks were available.Now I don't even play this because of hackers.If Activision wants to sell CoD on PC, they need to make it hack-free and take some strong precautions.
-Delay,lags,ping issues.Some maps are laggy as hell, Defender as an example.I sometimes shoot people and they kill me, when I watch my death cam I see my shots are missed.But I'm pretty damn sure that I hit those.It happens a lot and is frustrating.
-Needs more weapon differentiation.Some weapons look/feel exactly the same and most Assault Rifles feel like SMG's.



Overall, I do recommend it because I'm having incredible amounts of fun when playing with my friends.Even playing alone, I'm having fun while I'm not raging to hackers.If they actually want this game to sell more on PC, as I've said before, they should focus on reducing hacker count.

Most of the cons could be easily solved with balance updates.But they really should work on hackers issue, just a dumb dull report system is not enough.

reviewText:
This game is the standard Call of Duty Experience with some added Titanfall-esque movement abilities. If you consistently enjoy Call of Duty games, You'll enjoy this one too. But if you want something genuinely new from the franchise, you'll have to keep waiting. This game plays and feels very similar to previous games of the series.

Singleplayer Campaign:
The visuals are much improved over Ghosts, with some beautifully rendered cutscenes. The voice acting is very good, with a great performance by Kevin Spacey. The writing however leaves a lot to be desired. There is some added RPG elements with the ability to collect experience and upgrade your character's skills as you progress through the story. The amount of customization that can be done is very little however and should have come to COD a lot sooner.

Multiplayer:
The only thing new here is the movement abilities. The maps are still small. The amount of players in a game is small. They did add Ground War" to this game with slightly more players on a map
date: but it's a joke compared to Battlefield's 32v32. The wait times for certain game modes are very long (Most everyone plays Deathmatch or team deathmatch). The available weapon pool seemed to get smaller
recommended:
unfortunately. I do have to say the Multiplayer as a whole is a little better and a little more fun than recent installments of the series. But not by much.

Bottom line: Not much new here. It is Call of Duty done decently with a slight futuristic spin.

7/10"

reviewText:
Most people that i play with think that Call of Duty is just a pile of ♥♥♥♥, but i think this game is worth a shot.
The campaign is really good, lots of action, lots of new gadgets and weapons and overall a great experience.
The multiplayer is very fun as well. There was ALOT of lag when i first started to play but i simply changed the settings and there was little to no lag. But after the second patch came out, MOST OF THE LAG WAS GONE. I can finally set my graphics and shaders to max and experience little to no lag at all.But besides the lag, the overall multiplayer is fun and fast-paced.

Customization - The customization in this game is insane, This is the most customization ever put into a CoD game ever and i love it. Before, you could only customize your weapon and emblems n such. But now you can fully customize your character, and im not talking just about the camos, or little things like that. Im talking about THE ENTIRE CHARACTER. Glasses,Helmets,Chestplates,Shirts,Pants,Kneepads,boots, and even your exo itself. You can get insane types of gear by completing challenges or by getting supply drops.

If you're wanting a fast paced and high-customization type of game, CoD: AW is the game for you.

reviewText:
This game is stuffed with high def/tech intro's for each level which you are forced to watch. But once you actually start looking at the details of the surroundings when the game starts the ingame graphics are actually of poor design. You are being played.

There is a lot of variation in gameplay, however Sledgehammer/Activision still thinks each gamer is mentally damaged or delayed in its development so the screen is filled with messages where to go and which button to push. And they are right, because as long gamers keep buying and accepting these kind of games and also accept the insane amount of money one has to spend for each dlc in order to play some multiplayer we will not see a lot of good games soon in this area.

Another hype not being able to fulfill my expectations.

The worst part is that this game has some really bad designed levels a for gameplay.
Like shooting the engine of a rocket before its launches.
People actually had to post on Youtube video's explaining how maybe it should be done so you could pass this level as apparently many people seem to have problems with this level my best guess is someone did not do his job correctly.
And of course a chase with some button bashing which is nice for kiddies but I am over 40 so please !!! and especially when it works like c.r.a.p.

Nice for 15 EUR but not worth above.

reviewText:
Have to thumbs down this game because of the fact that the optimization is horrible, no dedicated servers for a few maps like 24/7 at least, and once again: the OPTIMIZATION. I have a pretty good gaming laptop so please don't say that it's my PC. I ran a test on rar labs or whatever it is called and it passed.

My advice is to play the game on free weekends and/or get it at a good sale price. Don't buy for the full price unless you want to enjoy lagging for the price of 60 dollars.  I never played the campaign because I don't care for it, but I have played around 17 hours of multiplayer, which I think is a good reasonable time to write a review. Check my profile for proof, it's public visible.

The only GOOD part that I LOVE about this game is the zombies. Althought optimization is still poor, I love zombies and have been playing them since 2012 on bo1.

Hopefully this game gets better so I can make a thumbs up. Sorry if you didn't like this review but I just wanted to put my thoughts out there to see if anyone agreed. Thanks.

reviewText: While Advanced Warfare visually looks well and features an fov slider which was absent in some of the previous games, it still adheres to some of the sins the cod franchise has been known for on PC. There are no dedicated servers, fps is locked at 91, and some of the maps are unoptimized. To top that all off there aren't too many people playing Advanced Warfare so finding a game can take a while. Of course, the game does feature a single player and co-op which are pretty decent, but I don't believe those alone would justify the high price point.

ผมเคยเล่น CS source กับ Battle Field 4 ค่า ping ที่เล่นประมาณ 50 ms. ซึ่งก็ยังเสียเปรียบผู้เล่นที่มีค่า ping ต่ำกว่า แต่ก็ยังไม่เลวร้ายเท่ากับเกมนี้ เมื่อเราจ่ายเงินซื้อเกมราคาเท่าๆ กับคนในประเทศอื่น ก็ควรได้บริการที่เท่าเทียมกัน เมื่อเกมไม่ได้ออกแบบมาให้เล่นจากไทย ผมจึงไม่แนะนำเกมนี้"
