reviewText:
Fair warning to anyone out there considering this game as an entertainment option.

Don't get it for:
Multiplayer: Connecting to the servers is rarely a possible option. I don't know how else to describe this aspect of the review so I'll just give you figures: 2-3/10 times I am able to connect to multiplayer at a given time. If it doesn't work at a given time, then there's no way of fixing it, just spend a couple hours waiting it out.

Get it for:
A fun, compelling and immersive zombies experience with more weapon and overall combat variety than BOII. NOTE that you'll need to team up with a friend since finding a server is almost as rare as with multiplayer.
A decent, perhaps a fairly standardized campaign which provides OK entertainment should you find yourself without any other decent option.

Overall verdict: I can't recommend this game with a multiplayer that doesn't work. ♥♥♥♥ this game.

reviewText:
I could've recommend this game if there had been more people playing it, but even before the release of the first DLC it was really hard to find matches.
Games like these simply don't work without dedicated servers, not on PC.
The fresh ideas surely didn't hit everybody's taste but they added something to the game and the whole package seems to be balanced nicely.

If you love the single-player of CoD, grab it as the graphics are nice, sound is good and the gameplay is smooth. But don't get it (anymore) for the multiplayer. It simply doesn't work.

reviewText:
I could've recommend this game if there had been more people playing it, but even before the release of the first DLC it was really hard to find matches.
Games like these simply don't work without dedicated servers, not on PC.
The fresh ideas surely didn't hit everybody's taste but they added something to the game and the whole package seems to be balanced nicely.

If you love the single-player of CoD, grab it as the graphics are nice, sound is good and the gameplay is smooth. But don't get it (anymore) for the multiplayer. It simply doesn't work.

reviewText:
Can't play the game at all on my PC. Issue is after loading and getting ingame (for both Multiplayer and Singleplayer). After a few seconds ingame, the screen turns black and 0.1 second sound clip loops forever, forcing me to hard reboot the computer.

My computer can certainly run this: Intel 2600K, 16GB DDR3 and nVidia GTX 570 1280MB [2 in SLi].

Have had Steam verified, deleted and redownloaded, all that jazz.

Was running without a pagefile, enabled it, no difference.

Changed various video settings for the game (recommend, potato, slightly higher textures for not potato graphics). Updated to newest nVidia drivers, then also clean uninstalled and reinstalled, still same issues.

Disabled Audio devices in Windows Device Manager, Switch to USB Audio, to rule out audio issues. Also have downgraded quality from 48000 bitrate to test that theory.

All my other games do not have this issue at all (Payday 2, CSGO, Battlefield 4, Titanfall, etc).

UPDATE - 10 NOV 2014 : Update seems to made it more stable. Able to run without crashing Textures still load slow as heck.

reviewText:
tl;dr: I'd have to say skip this game until it's 10 quid or less.

I like to take my time with games, and appreciate the effort that went into the art direction, the strategy, etc.  Even with that approach, I finished the game in under 10 hours of game play.

On top of that, the action is even more tightly scripted than in previous CoD episodes.  Before, you were on a rail, but mostly in charge of what you did.  Not here.  Sure you get to pull the trigger in lots of places, but when it comes to cut scenes you lose control.  The game takes control and you're simply watching.

Further, when you do have something like the grapple hook, it works on some roof edges, but not others.  Some rails, but not others, some enemies, but not others.  In other words, it's scripted when you can use that too.

Controlling the airplane says invert the controls in the options"...but in fact there's no mention of inverting plane controls in the options.  I gritted my teeth and got through the mission anyway
date: but it was *no* fun.  The /mouse/ should have controlled the direction of the pointing of the plane
recommended: and w/s the throttle.  What a thorough waste of a scene!\n\nOh
hoursPlayed: and then there's the game instruction "Press and hold UNBOUND to slide when sprinting".  Really? What the hell are they doing introducing a new move in the last scene of the whole game?\nThe only way to get through that scene is to actually slide when sprinting.  But you don't know what action is desired here as the action isn't bound to a key.  I figured out it's 'Crouch'. Okay
voteText: fine.  Assign 'V' to it...no good.  Somehow the W and V got mixed up
helpfulPercent: so that I wasn't actually sprinting.  It was only when I assigned Tab to crouch as well that I was able to do it.  I was hugely angry by the end of that scene.\n\nAfter the open-world exploits of the Assassin's creed series
votesHelpful: or Elder Scrolls
votesTotal: and Shadows of Mordor this simply cannot compare.  Each of those games I've had 100's of hours of gameplay.  Elder Scrolls I've had over 500!?!  This game is a quick dose of adrenaline
votesFunny:
and then you're done.

Things I could say in support of this game: the graphics are good overall.  The facial animations are some of the best I've seen. The light sub-surface scattering really made faces look like faces instead of polygons.  Well done!  Also it was cool to see Kevin Spacey in this game.  The facial animations manage to bring his character to life in this game.

But that brings me to a final graphic glitch: most of the cutscenes with the fantastic animations have sound that played up to 1/2 a second out of sync.  When it worked
commentsCount: it was really very good.  When it didn't work
column16: the illusion was completely shattered.  Think a very badly overdubbed foreign movie.  Yuck.\n\nSince I don't much care for Multi-player shenanigans
column17: that's me done for full price for 10 hours of game play and equal parts of frustration and fun.\n\nOn sum I did enjoy the game
column18: but it's not enough of the kind of game that I like to play.  This is *way* overpriced."

reviewText:
Don't buy this game if losing to others because of constant lag frustrates you. You will find yourself randomly doing crappy because of lag, and then occasionally doing extremely well because the host was actually decent or close to you and far away from others.

Do not buy this game if you have an 2 GPU AMD graphics card setup. The COD developers not only do not program their games for dual GPU setups (either separate cards or on 1 card), but the games actually run even worse.

If you contact support or look online for help, the solution? Disable SLI / crossfire.

I was a fan of COD until they F*ed it up and made the game run like crap on my 2GPU setup... all because I'm a minority when it comes to their customers.

There are also certain maps that run like crap for lots of players, so they are never voted on to play, because everybody gets slideshow type of framerates.

Lastly, I have a SSD and 16GB of ram, so I have my pagefile set to only 1024MB. When you do this, COD is so stupid, it actually pops up with out of memory" errors because the developers did no custom coding from the console port in order to handle an actual 16GB of ram
date: instead they are trying to use the pagefile without exception.\n\nI may have a decent amount of hours playing the game
recommended: but that's only because I keep trying to get the game to work properly and keep hoping a misc. patch will fix my issues. Unfortunantly they never fix the slow down with my nice system.\n\nDispite Activisions claim to have 3 different developers working on the COD franchise
hoursPlayed: they have only gotten worse
voteText: and continue to release COD games that feel unfinished.\n\nPut your money into something like CS:GO where the community is supported
helpfulPercent: you have dedicated servers
votesHelpful: a lot better choice of servers you can connect close to you
votesTotal: and the support isn't just ditched after a year because the next one in the series is churned out to make the devs. and publisher money.\n\nStay away from Call of Duty
votesFunny: Ghosts and AW. (other versions of the CoD series never had this problem.)\n\nStrongly do not recommend a purchase."

reviewText:
First let me just say that this game is really fun and the jetpack / boost really make it more fun.

I really want to recommend it but unfortunately at the moment there are too many problems / bugs that can ruin your experience.

For the single player review I decide to just watch the playthrough in youtube (because 65 FOV gives me motion sickness). 11 minutes in single player and 8 hours in multiplayer played.

--- Price tag in Australia ($78.95 normal edition), yup that is before the conversion to AUD.

Single Player (Campaign):
+ Awesome cutscene.
+ Mixed gameplay (there is stealth mission, killed mission, shoot everything mission, etc...).
+/- Michael Bay the video games? (this can be positive / negative depends on your taste).
- FOV (field of view) locked at 65 (so some people can get motion sickness from this).
- Linear story line (no branching decision / outcome).
- Story is really predictable and unintuitive (5 to 6 hours length).

Multi Player:
+/- Fun and feel quite new with the boost / jet pack (this can be negative for some people, small maps + faster movement speed = getting killed from behind is really often).
+ FOV can be change (max 90).
+ Good range of options / settings for a CoD game.
- Not many people playing it on PC at the moment, so it is quite hard to find other game type (in Aus here, I only can find people playing TDM or Domination).
--- LAGFEST: yeah.... this is the biggest downfall for me, the lag is just so unbearable for me (getting killed while on my screen I was already behind the cover.... normal").
- P2P
date:
no dedicated server.
- Color bar for a connection status (why it is so hard to just put the ms number).

In conclusion I really can not recommend CoD AW at this moment
recommended: the lag is just too much for me to enjoy the multiplayer game and the single player is just not worth the price tag."

reviewText: Whilst COD:AW is a very good game that has brought Call of Duty a step forward, the PC version just isn't a game I can recommend right now. The singleplayer has a more unique story compared to all the other COD (although it's quite similar to MW2) and the multiplayer's exo suits have made the game even better. There is a good options menu with a lot of detailed settings but the reason I don't recommend it is because of the intensive lag you get. I've got a high end rig (R9 290, I5 3570k) and the game lags where and when it shouldn't. I get above 60 FPS mostly and the FPS periodically drops to 50-60 fps which would be fine normally but it only goes down because it stutters. What's worse is the singleplayer. The SP itself is good but the lag you get on that is borderline unbearable. I've heard that this game suffers from 'memory leaks' or something so the more you play it, the more it lags (this might just be the singleplayer as it's the only thing I've experianced it on. I wasn't even on max settings (like I should have been able to run), I was on high, and it would lag (after a while like I said). The game is a much better PC port than some of the recent CODs *cough*  Ghosts  *cough* but the optisation or something is just causing it to lag like a ♥♥♥♥♥ (a lot of YouTubers with better graphics cards like JackFrags, who has a 780ti, also experiance these problems). Great game but bad port I guess.

reviewText:
I have been playing the Call Of Duty Franchise since Call of Duty 3. While I'm impressed with the graphics this game was released with (Caps at 1080 unfortunately). I am disappointed with the amount of bugs and Video graphic errors. So far if you go on the Advanced warfare forums, there are hundreds complaining of a video stutter. I just dropped $1900.00 on a new custom built gaming PC. Therefore I should NOT be getting these stutters.. But sadly I am. Not to mention that compared to Console, PC gamers were stiffed on certain features. Xbox one seemed to get Dedicated severs off the bat, however on PC (PC master race) we were not given the same privileges but were sold at the same price.

In conclusion, if there were a way I could get my money back, I would do it in a heartbeat. Day three of owning this game, It sucks.

Rating: 6/10

reviewText:
I'm Recommended this game?
Yes and No!

I bought this game for 10 euros and pity the fool who preordered it for 60 euros and thought that he would get a good game.

PROS
------
+ SP: Game is still very linear as well as every CoD. And storyline is litlle odd in some parts but if u put that aside It is a very fun SP game. avg. playtime ~7 hour.
+ Drop system
+ Clans are really nice
+ Emblems/customization overall is great
+ Graphics are pretty damn good (which I don't give a damn but some do )
+ Gameplay is dynamic,fast and easy to learn.

CONS
------
- MP: Call of Bunnyhopping Advanced Lagfare.
- No dedicated servers.
- Weapon balance is terrible. Assault Rifles are overpowered, Submachine guns are terrible. Heavy shield noobs everywhere!
- There is a Laser Rifle called EM1, OP.
- Hacks.Lots of, lots of hacks. If Activision wants to sell CoD on PC, they need to make it hack-free and take some strong precautions.
- Delay, lags, ping issues. Some maps are laggy as hell. I sometimes shoot people and they kill me, when I watch my death cam I see my shots are missed. But I'm pretty damn sure that I hit those. It happens a lot and is frustrating.
- Needs more weapon differentiation. Some weapons look/feel exactly the same and most Assault Rifles feel like SMG's.

reviewText:
Pros:

+Futuristic weaponary
+Kevin Spacey
+Call of Duty single player campaign (see con)

Cons:

-Single player campaign is not optimised for PC with inconsistant frames and crashes
-Call of Duty single player campaign (see pro)


Call of Duty:  Advanced Warfare is the 11th entry in the franchise and with this one comes a more futuristic touch.  I loved all the new toys we get to play with and experience, but in the end it's still all the same.

The campaign is just as long as most CoD games with roughly 6 to 7 hours of gameplay in a single run.  Kevin Spacey stars in Advanced Warfare and is the head of an anti-terrorist / terrorist group entitled:  ATLAS.  ATLAS has all the advanced weapons, robotic suits, drones and chemical agents that you'll be using and/or fighting against throughout your play through.

The campaign will consist of you running and gunning through urban areas, going stealth, air missions, water missions and the sort.  All standard scenarios you're used to in CoD games.  Only this time with cooler weapsons and invisible technology.  If you like Call of Duty single player campaigns you'll like this one.  If not, then stay away.  It's more or less the same as always.

I enjoy the single player Call of Duty's for what they are and I did have fun with this.  Recommended.  Kevin Spacey out of 10.

reviewText: Pretty good game, one of my favorite CODs since cod:4.  Single player story is good and entertaining.  And the multiplayer is fun....BUT you can rarely even play online.  About the only game mode you can find a game in is team deathmatch, everything else will take hour to find a match.  I don't get it, maybe the servers suck, but it's as if there is no multiplayer. reviewText:
Ignore what the haters are saying, I've grown tired of the endless reviews of people who won't even give it a chance. This is easily the best COD in years! I've played maybe 2 hours of the single player but who cares about that right?  I have almost 80 hours in the multi-player and I am hooked...full stop hooked!

The class system is even more in depth than any other plus there is a supply drop system which drops rare weapons and armor mods which are purely cosmetic.  Imagine falling in love with a gun then getting a rare one that hits harder but maybe aims down the sights a little slower. Or a sub machine gun with better range but slower fire rate.  The possibilities in armor, weapons etc are almost literally endless.

And now my number one favorite part of the game. The weapons, my god the weapons.  In Ghosts I struggled to find one I barely felt comfortable with, in this game I wish I had 20 create-a-classes.  The guns are just plain fun and they feel right.

On top of ALL that the gameplay is fantastic. The mobility is an absolute blast, a double tap of any directional keep will boost you about 8 feet in that direction.  This can be used to turn a corner must faster to put the drop on someone or even in mid air to dodge that sniper you just noticed.

If you've ever enjoyed a COD game online, buy this...now.

reviewText:
The single player is kind of fun but does get repetitive quickly. It's visually stunning with some fun missions but nothing exactly challenging.

The multiplayer has had a lot of work put into it - realising this is their main moneymaker the developers have really made an effort to include as much DLC as possible both in and out of the season pass in order to make you spend more.
The multiplayer has NO dedicated servers, plenty of lag, and a lot of hackers. This makes the game a fun to play - yet highly irritating experience. Added to that, the PC version has a very low multiplayer fan base due to the ongoing issues including memory issues caused by updates and the ongoing wave of hackers. The ONLY playlist which is regularly populated is the mosh pit. However even on a moderate NAT setting you will often find you can only connect to one lobby if there are even enough people available to play.

The DLC is effectively rendered mute as a lot of players have already left the game leaving Season Pass holders like myself spending out ahead for the multiplayer maps but never getting into a lobby so being unable to play them.

The zombies addition is the only reason to buy the DLC. They really have put a new take on Zombies and is the primary reason to get this game. It isn't too difficult to find a match (albeit due to now being included in the base version of Call of Duty it is now full of idiots - thanks for getting me to pay out for something you then gave away for free!). There are plenty of hidden secrets and this instalment of Zombies will easily provide hours of game time.

200+ hours spent playing multiplayer and 20+ on Zombies - it is definitely getting harder to find games as time goes on so hopefully this game will be able to turn itself around. However until that time I wouldn't recommend paying for this. (I got it free from buying a monitor and the season pass was dirt cheap from eBay)

reviewText: Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare is a decent game if you enjoy: low frame rates at random moments, terrible skill based matchmaking (i.e. it doesn't work), over-powered kill streaks, and the worst spawns imaginable. PC hasn't receieved a decent version of Call Of Duty since COD4, and if you were hoping for something different/better this time, don't get your hopes up. I purchased this game expecting something better and more creative since it's from Sledgehammer Games; but for whatever reason they can't identify the problems I mentioned in the first sentence and fix them. It'd be nice if Activision actually cared about the PC community, which seems like they don't. It is really idiotic that Activision and Sledgehammer Games both seem to ignore the PC community even though it is a much larger community that can give much more feedback in magnitude compared to console gamers. So far, the best thing about this game is Exo Zombies, which can only be purchased as an add-on to the original $59.99 price. Not to mention the price is far more expensive in comparison to what you're getting. If you enjoy getting angry/upset, then this game is the game for you.\n\n-car6on

reviewText:
Its mw2 with new shiny's and moves. The engine feels the same, laggy, unreliabe, hackers welcome, no support from activition at all. I only bought it because it was publicly stated that there would be dedicated server <-- a lie.

It's trash. 2 maps don't load, you get stuck looking at the load screen for 5 min, then it tries to reconnect to the same sever, another 5 min wasted. If you want to play something other that TDM or Domination good luck, very few people still play. Have never been able to find anyone playing a different game type.  Game crashed hard, been very unstable the last week. Hackers are welcome in the game, they have not kick or ban option and don't do anything about the reported players. There are players that have hacked from the start and they are still very active, they are actually making clans with all hackers. The game has been out almost half a year and they have done jack ♥♥♥♥. They lied to us saying the PC version will get dedicated servers. 700 000 players x 60$ = $4 200 000 (not including season pass (wich is broken)). Must be nice to be able to make that much money by false advertising.

They game is no longer fun, the hackers have trippled since I started. Over 50% of the games I play now have hackers. I take the time to watch them play a full game, I'm not just a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ pissy player calling everyone a hacker. I used to be in charge of a server, I know what to look for not that they hide it.

2 thumbs down

The DLC was supposed to come out today, they have been advertising this in game for a couple weeks. Another lie, now its at least a week till it comes out now. Bs around every corner. Activision is a trash ♥♥♥ company.

Edit March 5:

Now the dlc is out, broken as expected. They didn't fixed anything usefull. If you like to do challengs and unlock everything, it will never happen. They never adjusted the impossible to finish challanged after they fixed a glitch in November. I'm sitting at prestige 2 lvl 50. Can't prestige just in case they fix it. Pathetic.
STILL NO DEDICATED SERVER, they are still making millions from there false advertising and getting away with it.

reviewText: In days past, I played every Call of Duty that came out. But eventually, they all started to become less and less inspired and felt more monotonous, and I ended up passing the last 3 or 4 games. With Advanced Warfare, the series feels renewed and that old charm is back. New mechanics, a fantastic story that doesn't feel like another giant-nuke/terrorism tale, and more customizability are just a few of the things that helped lure me back and regain hope for the franchise.

reviewText:
I really do have to give COD Advanced Warfare credit; it truly got me back into playing Call of Duty.  After about 3 hours of playing the multiplayer for Advanced Warfare, I exited the game and bought COD 4 and have never been happier.  (Didn't have it on steam, needed to re-buy it).  To my delight, there were still a good amount of people playing COD 4 online , and with that said,  I feel as though I never need to play the multiplayer of AW again, which makes me very happy.

Alright, so I'm just going to review the multiplayer here, as I am sure the single player is good, but just more of the same COD style, but one of the main components of playing COD is multiplayer, so that's what I am going to focus on.  I really found it insufferable.  The game play seemed just about the same as it did in COD 4 and the other MW's with some obvious changes such as the guns and exo suits which really just made the game worse.

I found all of the exo suits dumb and just not fun.  Multiplayer was easy, I had never played before and was close to if not top fragging, but it just got boring very quickly.  The maps weren't very fun, and the exo suits were more annoying than anything.  When trying to strafe left or right, if you double click you are propelled in that direction, people are flying all around the map because of how much you can jump with the exo suit, it just got to be too much.  Now if you like that stuff, then you might like this game, but with all of that, I'd rather just go play Halo.  They also added laser guns which made the game play terrible.

It seemed as though someone could just hold the laser down and it was pretty much a one shot kill in hardcore if they touched you with it.  So with players just holding it down, it just got to be annoying.  Truly, advanced warfare just seemed like more of the same COD with worse changes.  It's an expensive game that I felt wasn't worth the money.  I'd much rather get any of the other COD's or even get 3 copies of COD 4 and give the others as gifts.  It's not a bad game, just not nearly as fun as any of the other COD's and definitely not worth the money. The changes in the gameplay are not significant enough or fun enough to make this game worth getting.  The franchise has become a cash cow and it is becoming evident in the games which are being put out.  At least they attempted to try something different with AW but it just falls flat on its face.

Simply put, this game is not worth the money.

Also, its 55 Gigs of space I will be very happy to get back.  Hell, I’d rather use every kb of that space storing Randy Newman songs where he describe sthe sounds of Honey Boo Boo’s stomach growling.  That would be a better use of the space than keeping AW installed…

reviewText:
What I like in Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare:
1. Boost jump.
2. Variants, making the gun not boring...
3. Trully futuristic weapon (unlike Black Ops 3, Advanced Warfare accually looks futuristic, with lasers and stuff...)
4. Adding an old weapon to a futuristic game (examples: AK-47, Sten, 1911, ...)
5. Threat grenade (I can't believe it accually exist in game...)
6. Invisible camo!! Finally I can use them.

What I don't like in Call of Duty: Advanced Wafare:
1. Dodge move accually have delays.
2. Variants changes stats, I would love it if it only cosmetic changes..
3. Bad first person animation...
4. Lasers are not that popular.. People still uses normal guns...
5. Exo ability can't recharge...
6. Exo cloak stil easily visible... Please remove the unrealistic pink effects.
7. SAC3 + Laser Sight + Gung-Ho = True run'n'gun class. :(

To be honest, Advanced Warfare is the best Call of Duty for me. It just that my laptop sucks and if I buy a new stronger laptop I will play it non-stop.

reviewText: One problem the Call of Duty titles have had over the years is the fact that everything is just so... Well, horizontal. The maps have two floors, you can jump three feet and the closest to skill kills you see is when someone spins three times in mid jump throws a throwing knife and just proves to you that they have yet to even hear the world clitoris
date:
let alone see one. The high pitched whines of people who don't understand the concept of audio feedback matched only by the high pitched whines of the people who seem to speak feedback fluently.

In this iteration, the tables seem to have turned. Barely anyone uses voice chat and for the first time in the series; verticality is a thing. Now you can react when someone fires a round into your back by jumping into the air and dashing behind them to turn the tables and deliver an oh-so-sweet revenge kill. You don't feel like just a bag of flesh anymore, you feel like a soldier and more often than not, a damn fine one. Gone are the days when you had to be a god to achieve the highest scorestreaks and getting a killstreak to kill ten people was the only way to get the next streak. You can (and I have) work your way up to an orbital gunship by simply marking out enemies with your recon drones and UAVs. No longer are you restricted to using the old fashioned Harrier, AC-130, Nuclear Strike if you want to achieve MVP status. In fact, killstreaks pale in comparison to objective play for score.

The weapons admittedly require a little bit of balancing. If you go head to head with some of the most used weapons, odds are you'll feel as if you were playing conkers and your opponent was using a crane and a Volkswagen Golf while you were stuck with the seed of a Horse Chestnut tree. But that's where the beauty of the games' multiplayer comes in. You aren't limited to only three doorways and a window to get where you need to go. If you take one round to the toe, you aren't dead for sure anymore. Your exosuit offers you the ability to counteract the failings of all your previous incarnations in the series. You can dodge, duck, dip, dive and dodge to counter your foes; all while the world around you follows suit. There is new joy to be found in jumping into the air, plummeting two stories into the rear of an enemy team and unleashing a furious storm of explosion-propelled brass. You are both an object of death and a subject of it now; with your awareness, skill and reflex being the main thing to decide which you become.

The maps vary magnificently from an abandoned prison, broken for the most part but still with a functioning inmate tracking system (which you can use for your team if you are lucky enough to acquire it in a care package) to a multi-tiered holiday resort complete with swimming pool and the ability to fall off the edge to your death. But the glorious thing about each map is that you can always attack from the bottom, middle or top. If you go to the bottom level, you can almost always find a way to boost jump up to the middle and the top from there. This opens the game up to a new angle of attack. You have to be aware of what is below you, not just above you if you want to dominate the maps. Some maps are currently subject to some intense lag on some systems (particularly the maps Defender and Instinct); but the remainder work flawlessly.

Scorestreaks are fewer in this game but are easier to acquire and more variable as well. The addition of Scorestreak Modules" has changed the way they are built
recommended: as you can decide just how your scorestreak will behave. If you want to have an orbiting gunship with a rocket turret which a second player on your team can control
hoursPlayed: it is doable. Your remote sentry guns can become self-targeting rocket or laser turrets which can engage targets in a 360 degree circle and your UAVs can paint your enemies on your HUD as a red silhouette visible through walls. You can even decide if you want certain killstreaks to retain the score you've earned towards them after death; all while you keep others as they were. The ability to persisently earn score towards a high value care package
voteText: while you still have your airstrikes
helpfulPercent: gunships and missile strikes earned per life is quite handy. You may notice I said four different kinds of streaks
votesHelpful: which you can now have. There is a wildcard to have four scorestreaks on your class at once; which can make your progress towards the highest significantly easier if you can effectively combine your efforts.\n\nYou have thirteen points to allocate to your class and everything costs a point
votesTotal: so knowing what you do and don't use is very important now. If you never use your exo abilities such as a temporary riot shield
votesFunny: cloaking or faster movement; that point can be better invested in a second (or third) attachment for your primary weapon; or perhaps a missile launcher to counter those pesky UAVS and gunships. Your class is not far less limited with the thirteen points but without knowing what you work best with
commentsCount: it is useless to just spend them on anything. Your weapons can even have different variants; which change the stats or add a free weapon attachment at the cost of it being permanently attached. You can find these weapons in supply drops or awarded at 300 kills with the weapon the variant is for. If you found that a gun needs a boost in the rate of fire and doesn't need so much range; there is probably a variant you can acquire which will suit you.\n\nSupply drops are special awards given for completing daily challenges or play time; which can give you a remarkably powerful weapon
column16: bonus experience for a set time or even a nice little outfit for your character. Every kind of unlock is divided into permanent loot (self explanatory) or one of three rarity values
column17: which can be traded in for a a set amount of experience. The rarity is not dependent on your level or what you have unlocked; as you can unlock a rare weapon variant for a weapon unlocked at rank 50
column18: even if your kill/death ratio is negative and your rank is nowhere near what you need to use the weapon.\n\nWhen you take all of these features and add them together; you get one of the most interesting and enjoyable Call of Duty titles in the series. It is exciting
column19: different enough to be incredibly fun but still familiar enough to make it instantly playable and it's the best time I've had with a Call of Duty title since I used to play it with good friends. Even now
column20: as a cripplingly lonely cynic
column21: this game awakens the happy little mass-murdering psychopath that resides within us all."
column22: December 31, 2014

reviewText:
Call of Duty Advanced Warfare is a large subject to tackle, since the multiplayer is the main appeal of the series, I will be focusing on that.

Right away when you start playing the game you notice some huge changes in the formerly stagnant CoD formula, they added boost jumping and dodging.

This adds a ton of dynamic gameplay, using the battlefield to your advantage like never before, and almost makes you mind your surroundings like arena shooters do.
The game feels a lot quicker than predecessors, bar MW1, this certainly works to its' advantage in most maps, adding a lot of verticality to the mix, which is what CoD needs, since it's a fast-paced, arcade shooter.

What really pulls the game down overall is the gunplay, the characteristic gunplay of CoD is quick and deadly, however I feel like in this game all the weapons are peashooters.
Sledgehammer did a bang up job for their first title, but they're simply not skilled enough to handle a game like CoD.

The main appeal of each CoD game that really makes or breaks the title is the gunplay, in this game the weapons simply don't feel satisfying to use imo, the models stay relatively static and the sounds the weapons make aren't that characteristic, I just had a 5 hour play session, and if you asked me to recall a single gun sound, I wouldn't be able to recall it, the sound design is severely lacking.

I can still remember the Garands' sound effect from CoD2 clear as day, the characteristic pmf pmmf pmmf of the silenced UMP in MW2 still stays with me to this very day.
The gunplay just feels very weak, and I feel like this would be my favourite CoD if the guns didn't feel like ♥♥♥♥♥ to use, it's simply not enjoyable.

The PC version has a few issues, to name a few:

-TERRIBLE, I mean TERRIBLE ♥♥♥♥ing lag in multiplayer lobbies, I have a decent internet connection, yet I'm lagging every game
-You still can't alt+tab out of multiplayer games.
-FOV switching bugs up the game a bit, the FOV also resets sometimes while mid-game
-Some levels lag for the first few minutes, simply because it's loading in the textures, every GPU has this same issue

The PC support has  been decent, but a dedicated server browser REALLY needs to be added,
the graphics look alright on ultra quality, but the bleak stark colour palette they used really isn't my thing, but artstyle is just personal preference anyways.

Would I recommend buying it?
Simple answer: No.

Complete answer: I'd like you to buy it, but I can't justify it for more than 30 euros.(luckily there're CD-keysites)
I absolutely love the CoD franchise, I grew up playing CoD 1 and CoD 2, and I spent my teens playing MW1 and MW2, and I feel like CoD is finally moving in the right direction: fast-paced movement, innovation with each yearly release.

Will we likely see the boost jumps and the dodging in a new CoD title? No.
Will we show Activision that they shouldn't be afraid of changes being made? Yes, well, maybe.

Activision won't see innovation as successful unless they make more profit than they did with the last title, currently, this is Ghosts, which is why this game will hopefully be such a tide-turner for the series, if the game turns a decent profit, we might just see some high quality, more fleshed out CoD titles in the future.

Activision leads, most other publishers will follow in their wake, do we want more risky moves, like the gaming industry did in the past?

Remember: We're the ones who can choose, using our wallets.

reviewText: This port is seriously flawed. What should run easily on my heavy duty rig ends up looking like a mess due entirely to terrible PC optimization. But forget the visuals, if the game ran fine I could move on and keep playing. The problem is that in reality multiplayer is a stutter fest with an incredible amount of lag that results in cheap deaths and resulting anger. Activision owes us a refund or they need to start rolling out the updates pronto. If the game ran anything like it was supposed to I can see myself enjoying the new mechanics. Unfortunately at the moment its near unplayable.

reviewText:
Overall a good game sadly without necessary PC Support (90 FPS lock f.e.) and too many hackers/glitches/bugs.
But compared to Ghosts a way better game and a step forward for the franchise but i would wait for 3archs next game they just know how to make good games.

Pros:
-Fast game
-fast kill time (maybe a little bit too fast)
-Zombies (with DLC Price: 14.99$)
-30 Gunstreak bomb
-cool and interesting guns
-Microtransactions (Camos, Gear etc. idc about it so i ranked it pro could be con as well/instead tho. Price: 1.99$-3.99§ for Premium Packs like Championship)

Cons:
-Stupid Bugs (SAC-3 Silencer Audio Bug is still not solved for all players)
-Glitches (out of Map glitch)
-OP Guns (EM-1 hipfire only f.e.)
-Ranked Play (no lobby system, gun variants are allowed)
-massive lag on some Maps (Defender/Instinct)
-Ping Bar isn't accurate or the hitdetection is fcked up
-Report Player doesn't work in many cases
-Matchmaking sux (no not SBMM but the fact that you get lobbies with players from asia or russia)
-not a high player base (4-7k ppl max)
-f2p Weekend aka Hacker can comeback and hack the sh*t outta you weekend
-Hacker

reviewText:
multiplayer review : its dead, honestly ive been looking in many different modes, and none of em are alive, except zombies, but not a whole lot

EXO ZOMBIES REVIEW :
so after quite some rounds playing over the last week,
i got to say this became my new favorite zombie game mode.
as much as people complain about exo suits, i got used to it fast and it really adds to your tactics of positioning.
there is 1 enemy i think doesnt really have a place here, its the acid zombie that leaves trails of acid behind him that can kill you very fast.
the upgrades are back but not in the form of drinks like in black ops, but exo upgrades.
there is no 3 gun upgrade though, you are stuck with 2.
the medic, health, soldier, and speed reload, are all back. along with exo slam, wich lets you jump in the air and crash down on your enemies, wich when you are out of ammo....will come in handy.
speaking of ammo, the guns and grenade system are updated and feel better then black ops's.
the guns feeling of power is always on target, my personal favorite combo is the S-12 and TAC-9 (tac-9 is a wall weapon, so i can always grab ammo)
there is also a microwave-oven ray gun, wich bakes zombies untill they explode (aint that awesome?)
the upgrade gun system is also refined now as it allows you to upgrade a gun 20 times, wich also refills your ammo when you do it (just for that gun tho)

is the game mode perfect? no...is it worth the season pass and game at full price.
if you just want zombies, id say wait for a sale. (i picked it up at the steam summer sale for 50€ all inclusive)

I PURELY RECOMMEND THIS GAME FOR ZOMBIES

reviewText:
A true movie experience in the form of a video game.

Continues what Black Ops II started in terms of the futuristic setting, though goes further. Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare is set between 2054 and 2061, so the game's subtitle definitely isn't misleading - you'll truly feel advanced, using pretty much sci-fi level technology and weapons with a rather high amount of focus on the Exo suit, allowing you to jump around, dodge enemies or even go invisible in a way which is surely going to sparkle some minor Crysis flashbacks in your head.

You cannot specifically choose what perks is your Exo suit going to offer in a mission since the game has them all picked in advance for you; though you can interact with how the suit works to a certain degree using upgrade points, which you collect by finishing challenges throughout the campaign - such as headshots or grenade kills. Those upgrades allow you to get less recoil or aim down the sights quicker, for example, though the perks themselves are just set in stone which was indeed kind of disappointing.

On the other hand, what didn't disappoint me was the story itself. You might think that the Call of Duty games are cinematic enough as they are, but Advanced Warfare manages to take that to a whole different level. It's possible to feel the emphasis on a moviesque feeling pretty much every step of the way, and Kevin Spacey is exceptionally brilliant. If it were on me, I would have liked slightly less quick time events because when they get forced down your throat as soon as you start the game in situations where they don't feel necessary, it does get quite a bit too repetitive having played all the Call of Duty titles before. But I assume that it's something you should expect in a game like this.

While the campaign gets you through a fair share of twists and turns, getting you all excited for the ending, to me it did turn out a little bit underwhelming. I would have thrown at least a bunch of words in here about the last mission but don't want to spoil anything, therefore I'll be quiet in that regard. Overall, the story is solid, does have some memorable moments to offer and while I don't think it's the best Call of Duty campaign ever, the focus on a movie-like experience turned out to be interesting to say the least.

Do not get this game for the multiplayer. It takes at least 15 minutes to find a match (of course, Team Deathmatch mode only) which just isn't worth it. I can't talk much about this part of the game other than saying it's pretty much dead, because I was one of the unlucky ones who didn't get the game at launch and therefore didn't get to experience playing with actual people without waiting for ages at a time. From the matches I've played with bots I can tell that the game itself does feel like loads of fun, with maps based on verticality and the gunplay giving me Unreal Tournament vibes, though I assume there must have been some major issues with it making it next to abandoned as of now. Whether those issues were based on the game's design, performance or anything else, I sadly don't know.

One of the other two game modes which Advanced Warfare has to offer is 'Exo Survival.' It is very similar to the Survival mode from Modern Warfare 3, and it's about surviving (yes, really) against waves of enemies, while also allowing you to upgrade your weapons, the Exo suit, or even scorestreaks for points you gain by finishing off the waves of enemies. Sometimes, you also get an objective round, which involves not only killing the bad guys but also fulfilling a set goal, like defending a certain position or gathering items. I really liked the mode in Modern Warfare 3 so I'm glad it's back, since something about it just makes it rather enjoyable.

'Exo Zombies,' on the other hand, could be compared to the Treyarch's signature game mode carrying the same name, only with a twist in the form of - yes, you have guessed correctly again - the usage of Exo suits. I don't like Zombies, but I know people do so that's cool, I suppose.

To sum it up, I would obviously advise against buying Advanced Warfare if it's not on sale. But once the price is right and you don't care about the multiplayer mode being in an unplayable state, go for it. Even if only for Kevin Spacey.

reviewText:
I am a COD fan. I like almost all the cods. But this one is a strong exception. I can believe that, they wanted something new. It is allright, but a new stuff can be ♥♥♥♥ too. At least they have learnt from this mistake, because the Black Ops 3 is nice!
The problem with this game: Strange graphic: i can see the improvements, but the objects, nature looks like cheap plastic. The colours of the nature, the objects give me a bad feeling. Their mood just feels bad, don't rlly like it. It would be fine, if the gaming experience would replace this disadvantage. But no. sad.
Gameplay problems (in multiplayer mode): Annoying movement, and animation. The worst is the exo jump. It's just like teleporting with lag, and it looks bad too. It is still annoying, if i do the exojump.
When i played multiplayer, i felt like, the role of the shooting weapons is low. I always get killed by something crap drone, jet, or whatever. But almost never by shot. And that is really bad. This is a shooting game, not a drone simulator. The main thing is the WEAPONS. And when You get killed by an almost immortal fighter helicopter like 8 times in a row, that is a good reason to close to game, and don't have the whilling to play with it again. And this was just one of the many problems. Other ppl also noticed these problems, because that is ridiculous if i go to play with this game 1 year after it's been launched and there are 650 people playing with it online(whole world). I could not join any lobby. Waited 20 minutes, nothing.

So the main things: bad mood graphic
Annoying exo stuffs, contains all the features from the invisibility to the jumping bs.
And one of the worse: U don't require shooting skills. You camp somewhere, get like 4-5 kills somehow, and from that, You can own the servers with magic helicopters, tanks, drones and other craps.

Sorry for my english, it's not my native language, but somehow i need to write this down.

GG

reviewText: Multiplayer and Singleplayer Campaign is on point, Sledgehammer games nailed both playstyles and storylines. The biggest problem is the gameplay. I cannot play for more than 1 hour and not get a black screen or PC shutdown. My PC specs are well over the recommendations and I could play games with much higher graphics at the highest settings. But for some reason, I must set this game at the lowest possible settings, and I still get black screens. That is just the multiplayer, in singleplayer, I cannot get past any cutscenes since my PC shuts down or freezes saying that I have run out of Disk Space, but my free disk space could handle more than this game itself. A fix would be well appreciated, but otherwise, I wouldn't recommend this game at the moment.

reviewText:
Multiplayer doesn't work yet. Same error since release day.. 'Error: can't connect to server at this time. Please try again later'. The activision support centre claim there are no server issues... yet... it doesn't work. If they claim there are no issues, that implies to me they're not working on fixing anything. So if they don't contact me soon about the problem, or at least acknoledge there are major issues will the multiplayer servers then i'll probably go for a refund.


EDIT: Once up and running without problems, I played this game a bit. It didn't captivate me as much as modern warfare 3.
I think that I was expecting more of the same, but i found the game play very different when playing multiplayer. I think it was the jet pack that every player has that I found most frustrating. Certain tactics, such as stratigical positions and knowledge of common player movements and setting up an ambush didn't really work how I expected it to. I found that as soon as you are in a position to shoot at a group of enermies, they can all just fly away and scatter themselves and you loose the ability to take out groups with clever play. Becasue it was lacking that, it's not really what i wanted.
It actually reminded me a lot of how unreal tournement use to play, or quake 3

reviewText:
This game had potential. I read all the other reviews but decided that by January 2015 most of the bugs would have been ironed out. I actually thought most people who were complaining simply hadnt allowed enough time for fixes to be released. I WAS SO DAMN WRONG!! I played all night some single player, multiplayer and co op with no problems. I went back to play the game a second time the very next day and the movie for the level im on begins but right after that the game crashes. Ive looked up solutions to the problem but there is no definitive answer. Sometimes the crash error has no information so you cant even search for a solution.

They have released updates which is what made me decide to get this game as I figured this must resolve the problems everyone was talking about but I was wrong. The errors that occur appear to have been not only in the last COD (Ghosts) but go as far back as MW3. That means that COD:MW3, COD:BO, COD:BO2, COD,Ghosts and now COD :AW ALL HAVE THE SAME PROBLEMS WITH NO SOLUTION! Its clear they will not fix this problem anytime soon as they have obviously had YEARS to create a solution and yet no where on the internet is there a clear fix.

Simply put they rushed the game to get it out into the market with the idea of patching it up later but there really is so much wrong with the coding of this game that errors are almost a certaintly regardless of how new or good your rig is. This seems to be a common trend now in the gaming industry so I plead that everyone simply boycott games from developers that dont give the slightest S#!t about gamers or artform.

reviewText:
A nice attempt to try something new with call of duty. The story is rather interesting but does have a lot of moments of why this and why that....there is even a point in the game where I wish it branched off and allowed you to make this simple choice of following a special someone or not to allow more story info and even points of view on why the story is built on these paths.

There is some audio issues during loading which seem to be fixed now, but there is a slight issue with the loading screen as it does provide a video giving some background story but it finishes rather fast before the loading is done meaning your stuck looking at a black screen.....why they couldn't of made the video longer (like Modern Warfare 2 allowing you to watch a long video and skip once loading was completed) to cover the long loading is rather strange as there is a lot of background information they could of filled in to keep the player in check with the story.

The guns are pretty awesome as well as the ability to upgrade and improve your exo suit which comes pretty handy allowing you to slide and double jump...however each mission does restrict some abilities for example one mission may allow you to double jump then the next mission takes that away and gives you a climbing ability.

There are a few memorable missions, one being a bike ride, another a tank mission and of course the all out war stuff.

However the biggest issues are:

1. Call of duty still feels linear, instead of trying to attempt a more wider approach and more non scripted events. For example there is one mission where it's all out war and you see choppers flying low dropping off troops. This mission and only this mission you are able to climb up there at your own chosing and gun the crew down, you can even avoid that approach and take a rocket to it or steal a enemy tank to shoot it down. This whole approach felt awesome and more in the player control.

2. Feels short. I tried the story on medium and then veteran and felt the game rather short and not really challenging, namely Black ops series I found myself getting a beating in veteran as mass waves of enemies charge my location and throw the unlimited amount of grenades behind my cover but Advanced Warfare never gave me that challenge and most times I felt extremely overpowered which isn't a bad thing since I'm wearing this exo suit but I ended flying through the game rather fast.


To me it's a good start and finally something a bit different then the rest but still doesn't feel right....like it's missing something. However Kevin Spacey does help the story abit....I think they put all the graphics on his face though because he looks really detailed compared to my other teammates.....

I would recommend you wait for a sale if your aiming for the singleplayer elements. For the online I can't really say much only that the customization is nicely done and the whole usage of Exosuits for online battles are awesome...but there isn't much change, there is still TD, capture , Control and still the same amount of player limit as before.. They did have a survival mode but it gets boring pretty fast.

reviewText: This is my first COD game since MW2. I really tried to be positive about this game, but I just can't. First off, there's massive microstuttering in the cutscenes for SP mode. reviewText:
The single player story is pretty much standard COD stuff, so if you liked the previous ones you'll like this.


On the MULTIPLAYER side... they had it all.. long development cycle, great movement, BO2 aesthetics, decent level design (with some exceptions), Pick13 system, less BS related to perks and streaks than the average CoD. However , like Agent Smith used to say What good is a phone call if you're unable to speak?"

That's what CoD:AW is all about - console lobbies hosted by fine gentlemen with wooden internet. No dedicated servers whatsoever. Basically another slap in the face to the PC crowd.  As a basic game design and engineering rule: when you have a fast moving game with lots of easy direction changes you need the lowest ping possible. And to get that
date:
dedicated servers are the norm. Guess Sledgehammer has zero multiplayer and pc experience.

Do NOT get this game if you're in it for multiplayer.

reviewText:
Campaign-Pretty much on rails as per some switched up combat with different exo suits
Multiplayer-Matchmaking isn't that great laggy servers, etc
-I dislike the majority of the maps they are very verticle (lot's of balconys and places with cover and vantage points) to accomodate for the exo suits (which aren't that great, they lack fluidity which makes them slightly annoying to use as it means every one knows where you are (shows up on mini map and they see you)). The maps are also very open so that it's essentially a shooting galley, I would've liked maps where there were less places to get shot from.
-There are like 30 weapons in the game which is nothing to BF4 which has about 80 weapons, most of the weapons are completely useless (snipers take too long to aim and there aren't many spots for them, might be worthwhile with iron sights, the first shotgun is okay and the second one is fully automatically and 100% useless (far too short range and far too little damage)
-The game has weapon balancing issues so you'll be killed by the same weapons over and over again
-the Exo suits while a good idea are not great, I've tried the one with a shield but you're dead before it's deployed and the jumping one is fun but you'll be killed pretty quick)
-Aiming, virtually no recoil so on PC weapons are unbalanced. If you are running and then you aim down sights then you will probably be killed before you can take a shot because it takes so long to switch and it takes about 3 bullets to kill you in hardcore and only a few more in regular mode, because of this you'll probably find that you have to walk around every corner or you'll be instakilled.
-performance, the game runs fine once I'm in a game and the loading time isn't too long but at the start I have quite bad FPS lag  and severe stuttering for maybe 20 seconds at the start with decent PC specs (of a 5-10 minutes long match). On singleplayer if you adjust the settings then it reloads the entire map along with the cutscene at the start of the level (which was clearly designed to mask the long singleplayer loading times) and it takes about as long as bf4 so go make some tea
-Graphics, can't fault them, the game looks pretty nice. I do have a glitch where the textures are ultra low res on singleplayer (e.g. you can count the pixels) I'm not sure if this is because I got it from my friends steam back up (he has faster internet so downloaded it in 2 hours and it would take me 50 hours) or whether this is a genuine bug, I don't like it either way and it takes away emersion.
-Controls, for the game they are fine, but for the menus it is clear it is a port, you are expected to be soley using your arrow keys, enter and esc to go through these menus. You can click on stuff to highlight it with your mouse but then you have to press enter to properly select it which results in you wishing you had a third hand, £40 or a decent game.

Overall my complaints are;not enough weapons, balancing issues, no dedicated servers and no server browser, most of the maps are terrible (in my humble opinion), you get loot (like helmets for your person) from care packages" which runs out (so essentially it's useless)
date: aiming takes far too long (the majority of the time I'm dead before I can aim down the sights (if I'm running about))
recommended: menu controls.\n--The things I like about the game are that you can customise your character
hoursPlayed: I'd add something else here but I can't think of anything."

reviewText:
Keep in mind I never played CoD:Ghosts. But I can honestly say this game is the last CoD game I'll be buying.

The single player is the same cliche underdog hero" that's in every past iteration of their games with the same either run and gun or hide in a corner until the enemies stop coming playstyle depending on your difficulty. Yes they have some fancy new tricks and gadgets to play around with but they don't add much into the game other than to break up the monotonous gunfights. Cutscenes look great on ultra graphics but the audio has been off and it just looks like spaghetti mouthed puppets.

The multiplayer is the most horrendous. Imagine Black Ops 2
date: the last CoD game I played. Now multiply the speed by 2
recommended: add in dodging and boosting and more cluttered maps. Like every CoD game in the past sniping is absolutely impossible unless you're some freak quickscoping/twitch aimer. But with the boosting and the dodging you've got a lack of actual aiming in the game. It's really just "double jump onto a roof
hoursPlayed:
jump smash down onto the ground dodge around a corner and hold down the mouse button". Didn't kill anyone? Just boost dodge/crouch/jump until you're finished reloading and try again.

The available weapons are all basically the same. Full auto or burst. The only single shot rifle that isn't a sniper is the last unlocked weapon in the assault rifle section. With about 5 weapons per class it's probably the least gun populated CoD I've played other than CoD: 2. Their spawning system is even worse than any of their other games. I can't count how many times I've spawned just to be killed by the same person who killed me previously within .5 seconds of the screen even loading in.

The lack of dedicated servers usually means you'll died in a single bullet while in the kill cam you'll see your enemy empty half a clip into you. Or you'll dodge around a corner and still die due to lag. Half the time I try to log on I get an error about the servers not being functional.

To finish it all off

reviewText:
I do not recommend this game. It is yet another call of duty game without any substantial steps forward within the actual gameplay. I am only reviewing the multiplayer (Who buys a Cod game for Singleplayer?).

The bad:

* Big Hit box which does not follow the shape of player (People blame rubberbanding, but It isn't always this. I have played plenty of strong connection servers, the hit box is massive, you can hit a player standing still by shooting off target haha it's terrible)
* No Leaning
* Sprinting has no aim penalty (Because your wearing an exo suit I hear you say)
* No 3D scope perspective (e.g. Cod Ghosts had it, RO2 players know what I am talking about) Instead you get a big black crappy edge.
* Weapon recoil is minimal meaning no downside to constant automatic fire
* Weapon cone of fire is incredibly tight, this allows easy firing from the hip without needing laser sight, ect..
* Maps are incredibly small, this makes for incredibly frustrating gameplay. You often spawn right next to enemies. Sniper rifles are a pointless weapon unless you have iron sites or acog as a long shot in this game must be considered 50 yards..
* Weapon atatchments make very little sense (e.g. Sniper rifle, take off a big scope, use an acog and you lose some weapon handling. (A lower powered scope, smaller sized optic, would allow faster target aquisition and less weight yet it takes -2 from wep handling) really strange..

The good:

* Incredibly fast paced action (If you like it)
* The exo suit adds a few more capabilities in the way of movement/dodging.

On the whole, I do not like the game. I enjoyed it for the first few hours but it is now just a very frustrating game. It has far too many negatives. It was 'not' a step forward in anyway. It really is the same trash recycled.

reviewText:
Maps are horribly small for how much mobility you have, for every kill you make there are 1-2 people already killing you from behind. A majority of the time you are being attack by 2 or more people at a time and if not you are running through corridors relying ONLY on your ping while going around corners.

There is no room for skill because of the poor server management. It's all based on luck and whos ping gets to horrible servers first. I will spend 2-3 seconds shooting some fellow in the face just for him to turn and double tab me dead, when I watch the reply from his end it doesn't even show I shot my gun. Not to mention getting shot through walls 3 feet after I was already behind it on nearly every occasion.

This is a flashy multiplayer ping test simulator filled with fun handicaps so even the 6 year olds have a chance at a kill or two. Much like an E rated EA game.

reviewText:
By far the most innovative Call of Duty ever.  The debut of the Exo suit makes the games much more vertical.  There are plenty of guns and attachments to keep you switching loadouts for months.  The score streaks are actually fun to use, unlike Treyarch's iterations.  As for the story, it is actually one of the more captivating and interesting Call of Duty campaigns I have ever played.  Sure it's still linear as hell, but the addition of Kevin Spacey made his character memorable and the story was well told and easy to follow.

The games performance on PC is surprisingly good, high resolution textures, and the game feels much more optimized than Ghosts, god Ghosts was bad.

Where Advanced Warfare falls apart is in it's infrastructure.  It's 2014 and we have a game that is one of the best selling franchises of all time and it rely's on P2P servers.  COD4, COD WaW, and BO1, all had Dedicated Servers.  Thats where this game goes wrong.  I can deal with the game not having mod tools because of the money hungry market that is DLC, but not having dedicated servers???  I know Activision is just trying to cut costs, but P2P servers on PC do not work.  When I try to connect to some jackass who is torrenting ♥♥♥♥ in the background of his PC and just so happens to get the host.

If this game had dedicated servers it would have gotten a higher score by me and other reviewers.


3 out of 5.

Good- Advancing the COD world with the fast paced Exo movements and abilities.  Kevin Spacey was a hit and a good decision to create a more legitimate feeling to the campaign.  PC options are good and game runs fine.

Bad-  Peer servers which lead to a lower population making games hard to find and sometimes laggy.


Would've given a 4 out of 5 if it had dedicated servers.  Perhaps even 5 out of 5.  Definitely a 5 out of 5 with dedicated servers and mod tools.

In the end, I recommend this game because it is still a fun game to play when you can find a game, and probably the most fun you'll have playing COD on PC since COD4

reviewText:
I gave negative rating based on the overall review. There are really good things in this game too.
Read to find out.

Single player:
+ Graphics
+ Story (you cant expect more from this type of game)
+ Exosuit (Always fun to have some gadgets)
+ advanced weapons like the grenades you get from ATLAS.
+ Stealth parts of the game

- Bugs (Occasional bluescreen of death. Memory issues?!? How that can be.. (I got 8gm ram + Gtx680 + phenom x6 processor, should be no problems there)
- Exosuit could have been much more fun.. feels quite limited.
- If you change graphics settings, the game resets and you have to watch the mission start videos every time again with no way to skip them. It loads long because it waits the video to end before loading all the shaders. You can change settings to load while the video, but then the videos start to tear...
- Voice sync issues in cutscenes

Multiplayer:
Really... even for a CoD this was disappointing. I didnt excpect more than a few days of fun but really.. quality of multiplayer is like from most of the free to play" games.
Aprrox. 2 hours of game in MP mode and 1 sudden crash to desktop.

Overall
date: Good SP if you dont have anything better to do.\nI dont recommend to buy for MP purposes at least yet. Maybe if they patch it enough good...\nAlso I dont recommend to buy if you dont have a high end rig."

reviewText:
I have a love hate relationship with this game.

The new double jump and boost dodging mechanic introduced in this installment makes every game mode feel like TDM. What i mean by this is that players can literally take any path to cross the map and this can take less than 20 seconds, so im finding that im being shot in the back alot. Additionally with the new movement, there's a serious lack of defensive play. I've mainly noticed this in domination when we have two flags everyone pushes the one the enemies have and flags are switching much more frequently than in previous COD's. The game has become even more fast paced than before and i can't keep up. Trying to solo cap a point that hasn't got a roof over it is extremelly frustrating because it is impossible to accuratelly predict where an enemy will come from because they will just jump over any of the walls and ♥♥♥♥ you in mid air. Despite all the faults, i still enjoy playing when none of the annoying ♥♥♥♥ happens.

This is just my personal insight into the game for which i have only played 4 hours and it is more than likely that all the hate is due to me being bad/ not adapted but its still frustrating to play most of the time for me.

reviewText:
Another disappointing CoD experience. . . I was tricked by the IGN review into giving this game a shot, and I'm sad that I did.  If I could get my money back(or even half my money back) and give this awful wretched game back, I would.  I wish I had a physical copy, so I could drive over to the HQ of the people who mad this slop and STOMP IT INTO PIECES RIGHT IN FRONT OF THEM.  That's how bad it is.

The gameplay is typical CoD. . . which is to say that it is laggy, glitchy, with cramped maps and enemies spawning right on top of you.  Balance?  LOL!  The game is filled with people running around with auto shotguns and quick-scopers and you'll rarely get into a satisfying gunfight.  The maps are very vertical and circular in nature, and you'll just as often be shot in the back by someone who just spawned as from the front.  The new exo-suit perks are completely pointless, because they all take a second or two to activate.  By the time you realize you NEED a shield(or a cloaking device, or speed), you're already dead or the moment has already passed.

The controls on PC are absolutely AWFUL because they've been ported from console with no consideration as to the unique qualities of the PC platform.  As an example: if you double tap any of your main movement keys(WASD), your character will dash/dodge" in that direction.  Now
date: the absurdity of this becomes immediately obvious if you've ever PLAYED with a keyboard before. . . you rarely HOLD the A or D keys for any length of time
recommended: instead you usually tap them to inch your character around a corner or other obstacle.  However
hoursPlayed: the "dodge" mechanic means that if you EVER press one of those keys in quick succession
voteText: your character will dash in that direction.  This means that in nearly every gunfight(when you press the keys quickly to dodge around)
helpfulPercent: your character will mis-interpret a desire for "strafe right" into "dodge right" at least once
votesHelpful: sending your character on an uncontrollable dash that throws off your aim(but isn't fast enough to actually dodge incoming fire).  This makes every gunfight feel like you're riding a bull that will randomly dart off in one direction or another
votesTotal: and you just have to hold on for dear life and hope that it all turns out alright.\n\nAlso
votesFunny: if you have a modern mouse that polls at 1000hz
commentsCount: you're screwed
column16: because the game will randomly accelerate and decelerate your mouse inputs.  Imagine someone randomly turning your mouse DPI from 400 up to 6000 as you play the game. . . it's impossible to deal with.  There IS a solution however. . . you just have to turn your mouse's polling rate down to 125hz
column17: which is fine if we're playing in 1999
column18: but hilariously bad for 2014.  All that money you spent on a nice mouse?  wasted.  Also: you're going to have to go into your mouse settings and turn it back up to 1000hz any time you leave CoD to play ANYTHING ELSE. . . which is another stupid annoyance to deal with.  Best solution for that?  Simply don't play CoD. . . problem solved.\n\nI beg you
column19: IMPLORE you
column20: my fellow gamers

don't make my mistake.  Take your hard earned dollars and spend them on literally ANY other game than this one.  You'd be better off throwing money at random kickstarter games that MIGHT turn out to be good than this TERRIBAD GAME.

LEARN FROM MY MISTAKES!  HEED MY WARNING!

TL:DR:

reviewText:
Today's Review: Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare

At first this was going to be a positive review, i've waited for the CoD franchise to add exo suit, special abilities like other games more than just run and gun, but after seeing this game in action it's a huge disapoinment and a total waste of money.

Let me start by poiting out what it bothers me the most, i don't have a high end rig but i do have a rig that's over the recomended reqs for this game and yet the game runs on low at 90~158 fps with CONSTANT FREEZES AND STUTTERING, i mean it just won't stop, and if i run it on high settings i still get at least 90 fps that i never get to see because they game will be freezing 4 seconds, 1 second of game and then 4 seconds of freeze, i have no idea why this is happening to me, i've seen videos on youtube of other ppl with the same computer having no problems with the game and it's just confusing for me.

Overview: As a fan of the CoD saga i have high hopes for this game, tho i knew it will be complete failure, at least on pc, the game it's the next installment of the modern warfare part of call of duty and next from Ghots (which in my opinion was far better than this one, i actually really liked that game except for the ending) dispite the fact most ppl think that Ghots it's a bad game and i'm gonna get a lot of down votes for this, this game pretty much gives you the idea of high stakes while clearly is just another cod, activision, sledgehammer and infinity ward don't take chances anymore, they just put call of duty and a price and it's gonna sell, we all know it.

Pros:
* Exo-abilites like boost jump, overdrive, stim, exo cloack and maybe some others
* Kevin Spacey

Cons:
* Terrible optimization
* Multiplayer is dead
* Peer 2 Peer servers (2015 and still no dedicated servers with the promise of them coming soon")
* Extremly Linear and predictable story
date: you will see what's gonna happend from a mile away in the night and blind\n* During the single player you never feel you're in control
recommended: all scripted for 1 path and it's borring and more of the same\n* Things like the grapple

Metascore: 42/100"

reviewText:
Admittedly, i had reservations, Between Ghosts which in my short time playing bored me to tears and Titanfall that kept me entertained for hours on end i didnt know where to land on this game, My main fear was that it was going to feel like a cheap immitation of Titanfall, I couldnt have been more wrong. This, at its core is Call Of Duty, in a good way, in my opinion Sledgehammer achieved with Advanced Warfare what Treyarch Failed with Black Ops II.

Single Player Camaign:
Very fun single player mode, The campaign offers many twists and unexpected moments, alongside the jaw dropping slow-mo breach and clear moments we have all come to love.
The Campaign didnt leave me bored, running a generic objective, it was intuative and offered a choice of approaches to all situations depending on the way youre upgrading your Exo, which really allows you to take a personal run at it, The campaign only stands at about 5 - 6 hours long, which as immersive as it is, passes awfully quickly. I personally was sad to see it end, i found it to be the most immersive and gripped COD Campaign to date, the beautifully done CGI cutscenes are a real nice touch, really makes you want to sit and watch what unfolds.

Multiplayer mode
Im going to start by saying it isnt without its problems, I personally experienced little to none, but know my share of people who spent the first few days furious at it, The problems seem to land on latency due to a lack of dedicated servers, That aside the Multiplayer in my opinion is one of the franchises best, especially lately. Its fun and entertaining, the futuristic weaponry adds a new element to the game that you cant wait to explore as you go about unlocking things, the game boasts 35 weapons, but with unlockable weapon variations the count is in the hundreds, and those variations arent just cosmetic enhancements, they come in the shape of stat boosts and nerfs along with, in some cases, massive appearance alterations, essentially making it an all new weapon in my book.
The maps dont feel re-rolled and like you have run them before, like i experienced time and time again in previous titles, they feel fresh and up to date, i personally found the maps a nice balance of long/short range, tight corners and routes theres no one way from 1 side to the other, especially when your equipped with that jump pack, my only issue movement wise is the high amount of inaccesible rooftops and high points, but its easily forgotten once you get into the swing of things, running, leaping or sliding your way into combat.

10/10. Definitly.

But of course, thats just one mans opinion. Theres only really one way to find out whether it for you.
See you on the field.

reviewText:
The Game had potential to be the best Call of Duty ever. The Movement, Graphics, Sound effects, Particle systems; aesthetically this game was impressive.

The Game iteself is killed by the plague that is Call of duty. The 20 seconds of fun system every CoD uses except maybe CoD4. Where the devs intentionally make ♥♥♥♥ tier spawns for you to be killed or kill people at and power creep the hell out of all the gear, esp. explosives.

I came in expecting that, but what really killed the ENTIRE game for me was the fact the maps do not compensate the new mobility almost at all, and the maps themselves were unimaginative garbage. I see clearly the devs had no strategical value when designing these maps.

Campaign is very fun and feels cinematic at times, DECENT at best story+plot+narrative. The promise, and let down of dedicated servers was a shame, matchmaking can be near impossible at times and often freeze at synchronizing game settings. When you do happen to get into a game youll experience heavy hangs/lag for a couple seconds as base. If the host is on economy internet, you will lag every couple seconds. Yet again, Host ALWAYS wins.

Overall Verdict:
Campaign-9/10
Multiplayer-6-10, I could have done a better job balancing this myself.

Its astonishing how a AAA studio can never get it right. It's also our fault for being bated into their Extrinsic trance, and buying the same product year after year always Hoping" it will be better."

reviewText:
I have to say, this COD really differentiates itself from the rest of the pack.
The single player is much of what you'd expect from a multiplayer oriented FPS. The story is bland, but does a decent job of keeping your attention. One mission I really liked used actual stealth mechanics, rather than the old guided ones where your partner pointed at people and said shoot. I would've liked to have seen more of that. However, not as bad as Ghosts, by any means.
The Multiplayer is really where this game shines. The new exo suit offers a fresh twist that was much needed by the series, with the exo ability acting as a physical perk without one being significantly overpowered than the others. Jumping across rooftops and clearing the entire map in seconds is a blast, along with the awesome combat senarios you find yourself in as you and the enemy dash around each other. They added random loot crate (think tf2) drops which provide another thing to work for allowing you to get new gun varients and new customization options for your soldier. The only bad thing I've really seen so far is the initial lag when you join/start a match. Dedicated servers have been around for years, and the fact that they don't is kind of insulting.
Other than that, I would recommend this game to anyone who's been a long time fan of the series> ITs a lot of fun to stomp around with friends, and fly from rooftops. Overall I give it a solid 8 out of 10
