reviewText:
Ok, I decided to ammend my review because of a number of frustrations with this game from playing it more.

First, the connection issues. I sync out WAY too much. The connection handler of this game is IMMENSELY buggy and I spend nearly half my time just trying to get into games. Its a real problem since it happens frequently. Then there's also the fact it takes several attempts just to connect online in the first place.

Then there's the fact that I can't ever get into a hardpoint, momentum, uplink or search and rescue mission. Everyone plays TDM and a few play DOM. Dom is ok, but gets old, and TDM is BOOORRINNG. There needs to be more incentive to play the more interesting game modes.

The spawning is just rediculous too. Constant and random locations just makes it impossible to do anything tactical and death is meaningless.

I'm quickly finding myself tiring of this game and I was hoping to get alot more hours out of it.

Overall, its a solid mechanic, but for TDM and DOM only? Not worth $60 and I would not recommend this to my friends even though I'd love for them to play with me. These things need to get fixed.

Original Review: {Overall a really fun game (talking about the MP, the single player is meh). Its fast paced and has an interesting assortment of abilities and weapons, its a really solid MOBA that feels like a cross between counter-strike and unreal tournament. Nothing is particularly ground breaking and maybe it's not worth the full $60, but its fun nonetheless.

My biggest complaint is that there are alot of people playing this game that have obviously been playing CoD forever and play the ♥♥♥♥ out of this game. If you're more of a casual player like me, you're going to get destroyed in a match with them, which can be less than fun. It would be nice to have some tiered matchmaking to help compensate for this to make it that you're more likely to play with people around your skill level.}

reviewText:
One thing I've always enjoyed in past COD games is the single player component. No matter how boring the MP component is, SP was always well written and provides hours of fun. However, this isn't the case with COD:AW.

The story is very blant and uninteresting, and the gameplay is just a mess. Unlike the previous COD games, which has a strong plot as a backbone that builds up the climax gradually, everything happens too fast in AW's SP. The plot is also extremely predictable and does not have any emotional factors in it, unlike the previous games. Gameplay in both SP and MP is just a load of cluster♥♥♥♥, and feels like a poor Titanfall ripoff.

Definitely would not recommend.

reviewText:
What a huge disappointment this game is. Today I think I spent more time waiting to get into MP matches than actually plaing it. Frequently had to sit through several cycles of having the game act like it was connecting to a match (Synchronizing..., etc.) only to get stuck until it finally times out (maybe 2 minutes or so?). I've had to repeat this two or three times before I can get a single match. It's not just today though. I've had these issues since I bought the game a couple of weeks ago (mid Jan. 2015). Can hardly chalk it up to 'well it's brand new and has a few bugs.'

Once in, it was a complete lagfest until I did that maxPing config change folks are talking about on the internet. It seems the default maxPing for server connection is 800ms! Seriously!? That's probably the REAL reason they show us 'bars' instead of actual ping numbers.

And no, don't try to tell me how my hardware or my hard-wired, 120 Mbps, open NAT internet connection where I can regularly play on BF4 servers with 20ms ping are at fault. I used to LOVE the CoD franchise and I've owned all of the PC titles since the original MW. I thought Black Ops II was one of the most fun MP titlles I had played in quite some time. After the steaming pile of crap that was CoD: Ghosts, I reluctantly joined some friends playing BF4 and I must say I found it quite enjoyable. Not the same fast pace I had come to expect in CoD, but when playing with friends, very enjoyable. A friend of mine talked me into trying AW a couple of weeks ago. Well . . .

If you like multiplayer, SAVE YOUR MONEY!

reviewText:
Overall, for the most part, and about three months later Call of Duty - Advanced Warfare is fairly fun to play.

However...

Issues include lag on several types of map loads.  Where the map named 'Defender' lags at first and can a good minute plus into the game, then still run laggy through game, but quite as much as on load.

And when you team up, half the time your team can get into or stay in the game with you.

Hackers, cheaters (variety of types) are still an issue on PC.

Also, why can't (surely there is enough players online most parts of the week/weekend?) we, as a team, play against others at least in our own country only.  PING TIMES at times are horrible.

The Good...

The graphics look really crisp on my above-average gaming rig!

reviewText: I feel like I have been ripped off after the Havoc DLC release for PC, I cannot believe that it did not come out in hard core other than in Moshpit, not a real user friendly way to access the new maps.  If that was the intent it should have been advertised as such, don't you realise that there are a significant amount of online players that only play the hard core mode games. I won't get in to the issue with the delay and the new maps not working, we all know that crap happens and the double XP was nice thanks, unfortunately the new maps have been out for over a week now and there are still problems with some of them loading.  There should be a public apology made and the issue of the lack of support for the hard core game mode resolved.  If not there should be refunds for those who purchased either the season pass like myself, or the individual Havoc map pack under the pretense that there would be hard core games, this is a major oversight in my opinion, there should be equal game options for both modes of play.  I hope Sledgehammer Games steps up and takes responsibility for this issue and resolves the problem by either enabling hard core for the identical modes of game play available in standard, or offering refunds to those that purchased the DLC under false pretense.  There are still issues with some of the original maps downloading that have yet to be fixed as well, this could be a great game if only there was some real support available.\n

reviewText:
This game has recieved massive criticism, I can understand why, and during launch I agreed.
But it has been a while since launch and the developers have stepped up their game quite a bit. Honestly for a guy that didn't even like the franchise (with overpowered killstreaks and weird knifing in the foot kills) this game is actually worth buying, it's not laggy anymore (depending if your/the host internet connection sucks or not), the exo-suits allows for awesome plays, the maps and killstreaks are balanced, and the only overpowered weapon is the Lazergun (which isn't used by that many people anyway).

If you haven't purchased this game yet, you should definitely give it a try!

If not for the multiplayer, the campaign is amazing!

reviewText: In all honesty, I wanted to like this. And for a while I did when I was playing with others. But when I came back to it later on my own...It was just boring. reviewText:
A rather good game. It is such a shame that it has incredibly overpowered weapons which everyone is running aound with, hipfiring and stacking up kills easily; such as the XMG and especially the EM1. Sadly, those weapons are ruining the entire multiplayer game experience - with the introduction of the EM1 in infected, that game mode is getting worse.

Also, at least there is done little about removing hackers (compared to earlier CODs) and people who modify the game. Sadly, far from enough is done.

At least create death barriers in infected just like in Modern Warfare 3, so people can't exploit the map and jump out of it, allowing them to be invincible to all infected

reviewText: Hi there! I know there has been a lot of horrible reviews about this game for the PC version (Hacking, Latency, Glitches). So I waited to buy the game for 3 months. Even with all the bad reviews it will still getting I decided to fork out the money for the game and I love it! Yes I have encountered some people hacking and its actually kind of funny how obvious it is the hackers will actually talk to each other about which hack they are using. The regular players usually team up and talk ♥♥♥♥ and report them and they are usually gone on the very next map! So someone is taking care of buisness! As for the Latency issues I have none! The game is very fast paced with a lot of fun people playing! Don't let a few bad reviews stop you from buying this wonderful game! Add me if you like!

reviewText:
Bought the game on 50% sale and totally worth it. Runs super smooth if your pc specs fit their optimization. Little to no lag (2 out of 30 games has had moments with lag) instant multiplayer games even at 5am in the morning and the game is actually pretty fun gameplay wise.

There is a bug that blocks your access to multiplayer if you click anything too fast after the multiplayer client is launched. You get an error (service not available blabla..") if you wait 2-4sec it works just fine.

I was really unsure about buying this game because of people leaving bad reviews based on their pc having trouble running the game normally or because of issues noted above that they was unable to figure out how to bypass
date: but im glad i ignored it. People complain about dlc/skin prices etc
recommended: but i see no point in buying it as it gives almost nothing.\n\nThe singleplayer was ok
hoursPlayed:
story was decent and i liked that they got kevin spacey for it. Being unable to skip cutscenes was a bit annoying since you have to watch it again from where you saved and quit.


When all is said and done i personally feel a game like this is all about the multiplayer and should be judged mostly based on that. Feels very much like this game was built around quick fun for when you got time to spare. Short matches
